Next, the disciple’s own covenant text:
*"Disciple So-and-So of the Cavern Mystery, from Such-and-Such Prefecture, County, Village, and Hamlet, prostrates and bows twice, reverently addressing the Primordial Heavenly Worthy, the Most High Dao Lord, the Venerable Divinities of the Ten Directions, and the Perfected of the Four Quarters who have already attained the Dao.
The precious talismans of the Thirty-Six Sections of the Most High Numinous Treasure’s venerable scriptures, and the Great Cavern Master So-and-So, by karmic affinity and accumulated merit, through the kalpas of the Nine Heavens, have revolved unceasingly. Blessed by fortune’s reach and transformed by the wheel of rebirth, I was born into the Dharma gate. By former vows, I aspired to the loftiest lineage, the great vehicle of the Dharma’s board, my spirit exultant, fearing only the decay of this fleshly frame.
Now, as heavenly fortunes shift and the imperial Dao’s destiny unfolds, I have been graciously uplifted and enlightened by Master So-and-So, who has opened my ignorant mind and bestowed upon me the numinous writ, allowing me to serve before the sagely lord. My mortal body trembles with awe, having washed away defilement and filth, and now attending the numinous altar. I bow in gratitude for this elevation, a glory beyond my due.
I vow to discipline myself and purify my body, to make offerings and revere the honored rites, to cast off worldly entanglements and retire to secluded heights, to forever forsake the paths of the world and dwell only among hills and crags. Day and night, I shall prostrate in worship, striving to exhaust my humble capacities, hoping to rely on the sagely writ to deliver this decaying frame. With utmost sincerity and single-minded devotion, I shall harbor no second thoughts. I dare not violate this covenant or betray my oath, nor deceive my master or slight the Dao, nor be all face and no heart, nor fail to preserve the kalpas.
I, having gathered my transgressions and swallowed my voice, dare to speak thus, invoking my seven generations of parents and ninefold ancestors as witnesses to this oath, and all living kin of my nine clans as guarantors of this covenant.
I delight in the immortal’s path and dare not be constrained by time. Should I violate this even for a day, may my life and death alike sink into the earthly prisons of the Five Paths, and may I never be pardoned.
Above, I proclaim to the Primordial Beginning; below, I swear before the Five Emperors. Before the master’s treasure and my own body, I establish this covenant oath. With cinnabar sincerity and utmost devotion, I humbly beg for your compassionate acceptance.
Your servant So-and-So, with reverence and awe, prostrates and bows twice."*

Next, the master rises and faces north, holding the two copies of the true writ in his left hand.
The disciple kneels, holding the token of faith in his right hand. The master strikes his teeth thirty-six times and visualizes the colors of the five viscera, fully arrayed to form a canopy of precious clouds, covering the scriptures and the master.
He then recites:
*"The celestial writ’s simplicity is not burdensome,
The Dao and virtue are complete of themselves.
Cultivate them, and you shall surely become an immortal—
What more could you desire?
The text shines in the Grand Interstice,
Resplendent and radiant.
Transmit and receive it strictly by the Dharma;
To divulge or slight it is to fall into hell."*

Next, the disciple kneels, performs nine bows, rising and prostrating three times, and receives the true writ. Girding the sash and grasping the staff, he bows once to each of the ten directions, beginning in the north and circling eastward to complete the circuit.
He visualizes the Most High’s true form, like the Heavenly Worthy’s image.
Complete, the master rises and paces in procession, chanting the *Step of Emptiness*:
*"Prostrating, I bow to the Most High,
Burning incense, I return to emptiness.
Luminous radiance follows my turning,
The Dharma wheel likewise circles thrice."*

The mystic vow arises in the four directions,
Auspicious blessings reach kings and lords.
Seven generations ascend to heaven’s halls,
Resplendent, their radiance spreads wide.
Whistling songs survey the vast desert,
Heavenly music delights my joy.
In unison, we offer the supreme virtue’s fragrance,
Lesser immortals cannot compare.
Wondrous thoughts illumine the profound awakening,
In throngs, they ride the void in flight.
Turning, they tread the cloud-net’s threads,
Mounting the void, they pace the mystic register.
Chanting praises to the Emperor of Unity,
A hundred passages self-regulate.
Bowing, they command the Eight Seas’ youths,
Gazing upward, they grasp the lofty immortals’ hands.
The heavens scatter fragrant blossoms,
A subtle, numinous wind arises.
Long-held vows root destiny’s core,
Thus attaining lofty eminence.
Beholding the music before the Most High,
Even ten thousand kalpas seem unbegun.
Towering, the Mystic Capital’s peaks,
The ten directions revere the August One.
Soaring, the Heavenly Treasure Terrace,
Its radiance flames like streaming sunlight.
Refining brilliance in jade-forest blossoms,
Vivid hues gleam like pearls’ essence.
Ever mindful to feast on primordial essence,
Refining fluids to solidify form and substance.
Golden light scatters through the Purple Tenuity,
Graceful, the Great Vehicle’s ease.
Looking up and down, I hold the Most High in mind,
Luminous splendor adorns the cinnabar field.
Glancing left, I grasp the Dark Standard,
Turning right, I take hold of the Knotted Brilliance.
The Six Perfections crown the brahmic practice,
Virtue and power renew with the sun.
Karmic fortune from past lives ripens,
Hearing the scriptures as if kin.
Heaven-endowed with transcendent talent,
Delighting in reciting the subtle and minute.
Embracing emptiness, the Great Harmony’s qi,
Exhaling and inhaling the flowing rosy mist.
Embryonic breathing stills a hundred passages,
In solitude, I fathom the three conveniences.
The Mud-Pill Palace gleams with bright radiance,
Thus becoming a Golden Flower immortal.
The Demon King reverently receives his charge,
Thus able to ascend and pay homage to the heavens.
All begins with fasting and precepts,
Accumulating merit to bind past-life affinities.
Soaring flight traverses the Great Void,
Uplifting the loftiest adepts.
Guiding the reins to the ten directions,
Circling to rest on the Mystic Radiance’s slopes.
Gazing up at the Kalpa-Blade Terrace,
Looking down upon the Purple Cloud Net.
Carefree in the Most High’s capital,
Together we sit upon lotus blossoms.
Through accumulated study, one becomes a perfected person,
Serene, the constructive and protective qi harmonize.
Eternally enjoying boundless longevity,
Ten thousand cedars—what abundance could compare?
The Great Dao’s master is profound stillness,
Ascending immortals befriend the peerless.
The noble scion transmits the numinous talisman,
The Great One upholds the cavernous scriptures.
Śarīra radiates golden splendor,
Dragon-drawn chariots suddenly arrive to welcome.
The Heavenly Worthy gazes from the cloud carriage,
Floating, floating, soaring through the void.
Fragrant blossoms like flying snow,
Swirling mists luxuriate on the mystic beams.
Bowing my head, I pay homage at the Golden Portal,
Hand in hand, we invite each other to the Jade Capital.
The Kien Tree’s Round Radiance Garden,
Resplendent, the Seven Treasures’ Grove.
Three hundred named celestial beasts,
Lions vast as ten thousand fathoms.
Flying dragons pace and chant,
Divine phoenixes sing in rhythm.
A numinous wind fans wondrous blossoms,
Pure fragrance scatters upon my lapels.
Without transcendent talent, how could one indulge this heart?
I adorn my nine-dragon chariot,
Mounting the void to roam carefree.
The eight heavens are like a hall at fingertip’s reach,
The six directions—how could they be distant?
All immortals recite the Cavernous Mystery,
The Most High sings a pure melody.
Fragrant blossoms scatter with the wind,
Jade tones form in the purple clouds.
The Five Sufferings all at once disperse,
The Eight Difficulties follow the scriptures’ emptiness.
Wondrous indeed, the Numinous Treasure’s preserve,
Raising this great Dharma bridge.
The Heavenly Perfected’s Palace of the Emperor of Unity,
Lush, it crowns the radiant numen.
Flowing brilliance, the Dharma wheel’s net,
Turning through space, entering formlessness.
The Void Sovereign’s village-cloud zither,
All perfected ones recite the cavernous scriptures.
Lofty immortals, solemn, join hands in praise,
Through endless kalpas, they preserve integrity.
The supremely perfected await nothing,
At times, they rein flying dragons.
Long fasts convene in the Mystic Capital,
Jade chimes strike the jasper bells.
The Ten Blossoms’ immortals assemble,
Purple mists congeal into a palace.
Jeweled canopies array before the Most High,
Perfected persons grasp lotuses.
Scattering blossoms, I declare my vow,
Grasping the tally, I subdue demon kings.
Dharma drums summon the assembled immortals,
Numinous chants resound in unison.
Nothing to be done, nothing not to be done,
Thoughts commune with the subtle and minute.

Then, facing north, he recites three hymns of reverence. Their words say:

*"Delighting in the Dharma as my wife,
Cherishing the scriptures like pearls and jade.
Upholding precepts to restrain the six passions,
Mindful of the Dao, I dispel desires.
Serene, the upright qi abides,
The numinous spirit, still and silent.
Heavenly demons all revere and protect,
Lifetimes receive great blessings.
Flourishing, the household and kingdom prosper,
Thriving, the scriptures and Dao arise.
May heaven and humankind fulfill their vows,
Ethereally entering the Great Vehicle.
Establishing a field of merit through intention,
The Dharma wheel ascends, vast and boundless.
Seven generations ascend to heaven’s halls,
My body ascends at daylight.
The Great Dao pervades the cavernous void,
With mindfulness, nothing fails to align.
Refining form to enter immortal truth,
Thus becoming a vajra body.
Transcending the three realms’ difficulties,
Dissolving the Five Sufferings of hell.
All return to the Most High’s scriptures,
In stillness, I bow my head in homage."*

After each recitation of a *Step of Emptiness* hymn, the disciple chants "Excellent!" and scatters blossoms, bows once, and completes the rite by chanting the Three Reverences:

*"With utmost sincerity, I bow my head in homage to the Most High, Boundless Great Dao.
With utmost sincerity, I bow my head in homage to the thirty-six revered scriptures.
With utmost sincerity, I bow my head in homage to the Great Dharma Master of the Mystic Center."*

Then, sitting evenly, the disciple prostrates before the master. The master recites the *Primordial Beginning’s Prohibitions and Precepts*, and the disciple responds with assent to each phrase, declaring his name: "Disciple So-and-so." The master instructs, and the disciple responds three times with assent.

The *Primordial Beginning’s Red Writ of the Five Tablets* is the scripture of the Highest Clarity’s spontaneity, the numinous, cavernous chapters of the Nine Heavens’ inception, establishing heaven and earth, unfolding the myriad perfected, pacifying spirits and settling numina, engendering and completing the multitudes, rectifying and governing the cosmic rhythm, preserving heaven’s eternal endurance. Above, it regulates celestial mechanisms; at the center, it inspects the five numina; below, it reins the earthly deities. Whistling, it commands the river’s source, directs and employs yin and yang, summons spirits and dispatches immortals. This most perfected writ, wondrously responsive to spontaneity, causes heaven’s heights to clear, the earth to stand firm, the Five Peaks to secure their guardianship, and the ten thousand kinds to endure. The Primordial Beginning inscribed it in the Numinous Capital’s palace. Through countless kalpas, its text remains steadfast at heaven’s root, never decaying or sinking. With the cosmic rhythm, it shifts yet remains unstained; defiled, it grows ever purer; destroyed, it does not perish; extinguished, it shines most brightly. This writ of the Great Existence is revered by the heavenly perfected. Unless one’s name is recorded in the imperial register and inscribed on the tablets of future lives, this text remains hidden and secret, beyond the reach of prying eyes. Those who obtain it abide with the Three Qi eternally. Diligently practicing its methods, they attain immortality.

Only through wholehearted devotion and personal reverence shall household and state know peace, life be preserved, calamities averted, and all inauspicious omens swept away. When the Son of Heaven and feudal lords uphold it, the realm attains great tranquility, hostile invaders submit of themselves, borderlands cease their strife, the myriad people raise their voices in song, and all under heaven flourishes. As the cycles of destiny turn and the true Dao prevails, those who obtain it summon forth the natural, the heavenly perfected in their wondrous majesty—what the Nine Heavens guard in secrecy. It must not be lightly disclosed, lest judgment befall your person.

Should a disciple be deemed worthy of transmission, though their years have not yet reached five times eight, let all ritual tokens be fully prepared. Following the Yellow Register, they shall take three masters and initiate nineteen disciples, their merit complete before the precious instructions may be passed. No transmission shall occur outside the proper lineage, nor shall it be privately taught.

Should one violate these statutes, recklessly divulging without covenant, both master and recipient shall face the trials of the Four Poles, their seven generations consigned to the earthly prisons, never to be redeemed for ten thousand kalpas. Can you not be cautious? Can you not be cautious? Let this be your faith.

Hereupon, the disciple rises and bows three times, then prostrates again.

Next, the Six Vows are conferred, saying:
First vow: not to lightly disclose.
Second vow: not to treat with irreverence.
Third vow: not to transmit recklessly.
Fourth vow: not to speak of it idly.
Fifth vow: not to violate the scriptural prohibitions.
Sixth vow: not to accept wealth in exchange for the Dao.

The Heavenly Worthy’s Six Vows bind the human heart; when the human heart is steadfast, the heart of the Dao is true. One must not break these vows or transgress the covenant, lest they endure the Wind Blade’s eternal torment.

As the vows are recited, the disciple first holds incense, one hand pointing to heaven—left for men, right for women.

Hereupon, the disciple bows six times. The master stands and intones:
The true Dao is lofty and wondrous, revealed only in response to sincere devotion. With a heart of red earnestness, moved by compassion for the Supreme Mystery, the Purple Text refines the essence, divine gold subdues demons. Radiant and majestic, its power grants immortality. Now I bestow it upon you—swear not to speak of it recklessly. Treasure and guard this descent of the true; to divulge it is to invite disaster. The heavenly statutes are stern—let this be your observance.

Hereupon, the disciple bows six times again.

Next, the master formally confers the disciple’s rank, saying: *Tai Shang Lingbao Wushang Dongxuan Disciple, Master of Such-and-Such Peak, So-and-So.*

The disciple kneels to receive, then retreats, holding the tablet upright before them. They address their root master, bowing nine times, rising and prostrating thrice, advancing on elbows and knees.

When finished, they move left to face east, bowing twice toward the west. Then they turn north, then east, then south, bowing twice in each direction, in homage to the Four Poles.

Returning to their position, they bow three times to each of the Three Masters of Transmission. Then they again read the petitions to the Ten Directions and the Five Masters, facing each direction as before, save that the Five Masters are honored facing west.

Hereupon, they kneel in profound gratitude, the disciple kowtowing and striking their cheeks without count. Their words are:

The Disciples of the Supreme Numinous Treasure, Peerless Cavern Mystery—this mountain’s master, your subjects [Name] and others—now burn incense and kowtow, entrusting body, spirit, and life to the Ten Directions’ Boundless Supreme Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthies, to the Perfected Lords of the Ten Realms who have attained the Dao, to the Venerable Ones, to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Revered Scriptures and the Great Dharma Masters of the Mystic Realm, to the Three Perfected of the Supreme Unity, to the High Mystery Dharma Masters of the Great Ultimate, to the Orthodox Unity Perfected of the Three Heavens’ Great Dharma Masters, and to all divine spirits within and beyond the Three Realms.

Your subjects, in transmitting the precepts to the disciple [Name] and conducting the altar’s oath-pledge, humbly beseech the grace of deliverance from the assembled Worthies above. We pray for absolution of all transgressions—from the time we first received form from our parents, through all karmic ties and kin, to the present—for the myriad sins and errors of your subjects and the disciple now receiving transmission. Since the establishment of this retreat until this day, we have violated precepts, broken laws, erred in conduct, failed in decorum, mispronounced sacred names, confused ranks and order, and deviated in the transmission of empowerment. We implore your great compassion to pardon and not hold us guilty.

May your mercy flow forth at once, your majesty manifest this day. Today, from the mouth of the Precious Pearl, countless beings ascend to its summit, joining the assembly of the exalted. Together they cross the Tiger Gorge and arrive as one, surmount the Dragon Mountain and reach in unison, attaining the four fruits of realization. Thus may the five vows previously made be fulfilled in this moment.

The Pearl’s mouth knows no overflow, water and fire cannot burn or sink it. Today, men and women gaze in awe at the Phoenix Chariot, awaiting the Dragon Carriage from afar. All these wise companions, each the father of their father’s father, share in the One of the Mystic Unity. May the five eyes reward diligence, the three luminances bestow virtue. May merit race like joyous steeds, and blessings of ease and delight abound. May the tally of death be erased, the record of life flourish. May the hymns of the Primal Beginning endure forever, and the unending celebration of the Never-Ending resound.

May each be granted extended destiny and discerning form, protection for high and low, life for young and old. May men be steadfast in faith, women guarded by the Dharma. May women bear purple tablets, men inscribe jade registers. May their immortality rival the Red Lord’s, their attainment of the Dao vie with the Mountain Chart’s liberation. May the paths of misfortune vanish together, and the steps of blessing rise through compassion. May emperors reign long, loving their people and governing the realm. May the Three Refuges be universally embraced, the Four Teachings widely received. May prisons and calamities be forever averted, karmic bonds eternally severed. May disasters and afflictions not arise, decline and suffering not be born.

For all other wishes, may each be fulfilled as sought: those who seek office attain office, those who seek nobility attain nobility, those who seek the Dao attain the Dao, those who seek the Real attain the Real. May all aspirations be harmonized, all desires fulfilled. May the Dao be perfected in heaven and earth, merit aid living beings. May it extend to all—the sun, moon, and stars of the heavens; the mountains, rivers, peaks, and streams; the Dragon Kings, Bird Kings, Beast Kings, and Insect Kings; the myriad spirit-kings of all things; all Heavenly Kings; the gods of heaven and earth in every place; the numinous spirits of mountains and waters; the officials and elders of villages and domains; and all guardian soldiers and officers. May they all turn in unison this instant, ascending together to the wondrous and sublime.

May the Seven Origins be peacefully traversed, the Four Symbols free of error. May heaven display auspicious omens, earth reveal numinous portents. May mountains open their treasure tablets, rivers yield their dragon charts. May the five sacred herbs and green grasses spread across the countryside. May the four directions be purified, the world know great peace.

May boundless merit extend to the overseeing officials, those who labor, and all who rejoice in this act—along with the men and women who observe and listen. May all with karmic affinity partake in supreme blessings, their dark debts repaid across the six paths, their joy bestowed upon the four kinds of birth. May the five sufferings and three evils, all sentient beings with consciousness, be cleansed and bathed. May they don celestial robes and sashes, delight in freedom, and form good affinities forever. May they become companions in the Dharma, never regressing, with the attainment of the Dao as their destined goal.

As for the altar master who pledged himself, [Name], may the five scriptures enter his body, the jade talismans nurture his essence. May divine perfected ones guard his life, heavenly texts inspire auspicious signs. May the eight assemblies align with the charts, the six perfections be constantly upheld, the four practices remain unbroken. May the five penetrations elevate him to immortality, the ten transformations enable his flight. May his body be adamantine and pure, his attainment of the sagely fruit resplendent. Bowing to the Ten Directions, may he abide eternally in the Three Treasures.

Next, the master recites the verses on the three destinies and five sufferings:

The Three Powers and the myriad things,
Dependent and latent, each has its span.
End and beginning await the kalpa’s reckoning,
When blessings are exhausted, heaven and earth collapse.

Back and forth through the five paths,
How bitter to die and be reborn again!
Turning within the three destinies,
Coming and going with calamity.

Great worthies, heed this warning,
Restrain your nature, sever your passions.
Foolish ones do not believe the Dharma,
Their sins and pains ever cling to them.

I grieve that the world knows no end,
So I now proclaim this clearly:
If you wish to escape these afflictions,
Take refuge in the Supreme Scriptures.

Sin and blessing do not come from another—
Truly, they arise from your own voice.
Great worthies, therefore, seal your lips,
To sever all evil ties.

Extinguish thoughts, attain perfect stillness,
Dependent and latent, await their final dissolution.
Spreading the Dao to pacify the world,
You will ultimately behold the True.

Lust and jealousy are the roots of misfortune,
The greatest perils to body and life.
Nurturing such harms,
How can the Dao find peace?

Knowing evil yet not reforming,
You will surely meet an early end.
Harboring poison while feigning purity,
You make me sigh deeply.

Karma from past lives is real,
Yet the weak call it nonexistent.
All desire to see it before their eyes,
Dismissing what passes as false.

Great worthies, enlightened by the Dao’s teachings,
Grieve for the stubborn.
Tenderly I think of your suffering,
Diligently I cause you concern.

Life is consumed like fire in oil,
The four great elements but a temporary abode,
The five aggregates a provisional loan.
In your prime, study earnestly,
Seek to preserve what is yours.

When blessings are exhausted, body and spirit scatter,
In the dark depths of hell below.
The sages above fear this,
So they seek the Dao to escape this calamity.

To learn immortality is urgent,
Uphold the precepts, restrain the heart.
Let emptiness and purity dwell in the upright qi,
And immortals and sages will naturally come.

If you do not believe these words,
Why dwell in the mountains?
Great worthies, delight in the scriptures and precepts,
Receive them as treasures for your body.

To study is always bitterly late,
To cultivate the body, regrettably not sooner.

When I now unravel these profound mysteries,
In a flash, years have aged me.
Clutching the scroll, I exhaust your essence—
Soon death will bring only grief and torment.

Thus in my youth I forsook the world to study the Dao.
Next, the Dharma Master turned eastward,
Spoke of merits, and resumed his office.

Tai Xuan Du Zheng Yi Ping Qi, Celestial Master of Yangping District, Left Minister of Ping Qi, your subject [Name], bows twice and respectfully declares:

According to the documents, your subject is but a mortal of flesh and blood, yet by fortune’s grace was born into the Dharma gate. By the boundless favor of the Great Sage, I have been graciously granted the inner and outer essentials of the wondrous Dharma—the Dao of immortality and deliverance from death. I humbly ascend the *Three Caverns’* treasure scriptures of *Shangqing*, guarded by the radiance of clouds, blessed by profound and unmatched grace.

The weight of the Dao is heavy; mortals are light. Such burden is not for this humble frame to bear. To fail the celestial offices would be to forfeit my very head.

Today, upon this mountain ridge, I transmit the precious scriptures of ordination to my disciple [Name]. From the midst of the Three Divisions and Eight Luminaries, the celestial steeds of immortals emerge—Divine Envoys of Flying Heaven, messengers who convey petitions and memorials. I invoke the registering officials of the Five Emperors, the local deities of the Five Peaks, the true lords of sacred mountains and domains, to oversee the bestowal of qi, to witness and protect this rite.

All is by the merit of the assembled officials’ protection. Overwhelmed by such grace, I reverently offer this memorial of merit and petition for all to hear.

May the exalted officials deign to take pity and review this plea, absolving all my past and present transgressions, countless as they are. Grant that my body be delivered from the thousand calamities and ten thousand perils, that I may serve as an attendant jade youth or maiden of the scriptures, as an inner or outer inspector of summons, as a lord of the Four Quarters and Nine Wilds, as a true official of the sacred mountains and domains, as a minister of the Five Emperors and Five Peaks. May my body’s Three Divisions and Eight Luminaries, the Flying Celestial Envoys, the celestial steeds of the heavenly offices, the guardians of the ten directions, and all officials—past and present, encountered along the way—who have aided in transmission, proclamation, and transformation, see their heartfelt vows fulfilled. May their merits be reported to the heavenly courts, their ranks advanced, their offices elevated, their merits recognized and promotions granted.

For great merit: three thousand grades.
For middling merit: two thousand grades.
For lesser merit: one thousand grades.
For scribes and minor clerks, soldiers and attendants: five hundred grades each.
May all return to the Central Palace.
May the exalted officials distribute rewards in due time, ensuring fairness and leaving none aggrieved or resentful.

Once the merit is recorded, may each return to their post, safeguarding my body, warding off the thousand poisons, public and private slander, the schemes of evil men, and all that lurks hidden in the Great Yin.

Unworthy of such boundless grace, I offer this in token of my devotion.

Humbly beseeching the Most High to distinguish and pity this foolish subject, I respectfully dispatch, through the true envoys of the inner and outer assemblies, the *Zheng Yi* Merit Envoys, the left and right official messengers, the yin-yang divine decree clerks, the chariot officers of the red talismans, the couriers of the fierce winds, the mounted memorial officers, and the flying dragon cavalry—twelve each—to present this memorial of merit and petition, one copy, to the Three Heavenly Courts, awaiting their decree.

Your subject [Name], trembling with awe, bows twice and respectfully submits this.

Your subject’s surname belongs to [Prefecture], [County], [Abbey].
*Taiqing* holds the rank.
In the year of the *Tai Sui*.

Your subject, having completed the covenant rites, now invokes the celestial and terrestrial deities. As they return to the Nine Heavens, may they ascend in due order. The *Yu Xu* True Qi Merit Envoys within this subject’s body, along with the divine transcendents’ mounts, shall proceed in their customary ranks, entering through the wondrous gate and golden portal of the Purple Mansion’s Jade Pavilion. They shall encircle the body, entwining the hundred meridians and bone joints, inwardly filling them with immortal *qi*, outwardly sealing off all sources of evil, refining the soul and preserving essence, that this subject may soon attain flight and transcendence. The transcendents’ feathered mounts shall ascend directly to the Imperial Throne.

Swallow the twenty-four *qi* and pause.

Next, the Dharma Master returns to the incense burner and prays:

"Fragrant Official Messengers, Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all attendant spirit officials—may this place of transmission naturally generate golden liquid, cinnabar, azure mushrooms, and jade blossoms. May the hundred numinous transcendents gather here before this incense altar, that this subject may attain the Dao and swiftly achieve transcendence. May disciples [Names] and their households, both within and without, receive blessings. May the ten directions’ immortal youths and jade maidens, guarding the fragrant smoke, convey this subject’s supplications directly to the Jade Emperor’s throne."

Next, recite the *Precepts Hymn*:

The Dao is the heartless source,
All acts become fields of merit.
One cessation—no fixed measure,
Each vow arises from the self.
Empty the self to respond to beings,
Focus the mind without partiality.
Great sages exalt the true teaching,
As rain descends from heaven.
Lofty and boundless in reach,
Yet humble, thus forming the abyss.
The sea is king of all rivers,
For it can forsake even dragon scales.
Through ten thousand kalpas, wisdom endures—
Not merely for one’s years.
Uphold the precepts without lapse,
Lifetimes of good karma bound.
With concentrated thought, contemplate the Great Vehicle,
And you shall embody the Dao’s truth.

Recite the *Returning Precepts Hymn*:

The Heavenly Worthy, in great compassion,
Expounds the precepts to deliver beings.
Majestic virtue pervades the hidden and manifest,
Karmic retribution moves the true numina.
All heavens bow in reverence,
All demons restrain their forms.
The past transcends the eight difficulties,
The present preserves a thousand years.
When the merit of the fast is complete,
Together we send forth our devotion.
The drifting *brahmā* chant soars on clouds,
Incense and fragrant smoke intermingle.
Jade phoenixes ride cinnabar carriages,
Golden dragons draw emerald chariots.
In life and death, all find joy,
Families and nations all know peace.

When finished, master and disciples circumambulate the altar, chanting *brahmā* hymns, and conclude the rites.

Alternatively, the master may return to the incense burner and perform the *Ascending Heaven and Treading Earth* rites upon the august altar. Then, master and disciples chant *brahmā* hymns as they exit through the northwest gate of the Nine Heavens—without looking back.

The *Treading Earth* talisman for dissolving form is inscribed in blue on white silk. The *Ascending Heaven* talisman for concealment is inscribed in yellow on green silk.

Some masters say: Before declaring merit, perform the rites in full. Then lead the disciples to face north and bow four times toward the Supreme Jade Throne of the Most High. Next, face east and bow twice to the Great Emperor Lord. Then face south and bow twice to the Highest Perfected. Next, face west and bow twice to Heavenly Master Zhang. After three days, the disciples may declare their merit, hold a fast to give thanks, and follow the separate scroll for the rites.

Next, the disciples perform the *Tally Tablet* rite in the direction of their natal destiny at the altar. Facing east, they knock their teeth three times, offer incense, and pray:

"Most High Lord Lao, Primordial Three Qi of the Three Heavens, summon forth from this subject’s body the Three and Five Merit Envoys, Left and Right Official Messengers, Left and Right Incense-Bearing Dragon Couriers, Jade Lads and Jade Maidens Attending the Incense, Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans, and Direct-Day Fragrant Officials—thirty-six each. Open and notify the local earth deities and the true officials and divine spirits of the four directions. As this subject now burns incense and makes this notification, may the true *qi* of the Ten Directions’ Perfected enter this body, that this petition may ascend directly to the throne of the Most High, Perfect, and Greatly Sagely Divine Lord and Jade Emperor."

When finished, turn to face the king and knock the teeth twelve times. After reading the tally, pray:

"Heaven unfolds, earth extends,
Nine *qi* divide the numinous.
Three Origins share the tally,
Ten Directions’ Mystic Purity.
Five Elder Thearchs,
Open the true and lead the living.
Cinnabar script and vermilion writ,
Primordial essence of the Highest Origin—
Universally proclaim to the Supreme,
Nine Lands’ August Spirits.
Today is supremely auspicious,
Myriad transcendents fix their destiny.
I vow my transcendence,
Plead to inscribe my jade name.
Earth Mansion’s Great August,
Erase my sinful form.
Present the tally to the Upper Palace,
Inscribe it in the Azure Register.
Swiftly attain flight and ascension,
Heaven and earth share the numinous.
Nine generations of kin,
Rotten bones renewed in glory.
Souls ascend to the Southern Palace,
Transformed in the Transcendents’ Court.
Today I declare my mandate,
All spirits heed my words.
With golden seals I affirm
My utmost sincerity.
As I have declared, so let it be—
Golden dragons speed the courier’s way."

When finished, offer incense and return to the incense burner, following the above method.

The *Primordial Numinous Treasure* addresses the Nine Earths’ Earth Augusts, erasing sins and inscribing names to seek transcendence.

The *Numinous Treasure* and *Red Thearch* Master, female Daoist [Name], aged [X] years, born in the [X] month, destiny linked to the Southern Dipper’s register under the Nine Heavens.

Explanation: This text refers to the *Red Thearch* as one born in the *bing-wu* year, and "destiny linked to the Nine Heavens" as one born in the first or second month. The *Southern Dipper* governs the direction of one’s natal destiny; the rest follows this pattern.

Vowing to become a transcendent, to attain long life and deliverance from the world, to soar to the Upper Clarity, the Nine Lands’ Central August, the *wu-ji* Yellow Spirits, and the Five Thearchs of the Earth Mansion—beg to erase the record of sins, inscribe it in the Great Mystery, and present the tally to the Central Palace. The golden seal serves as proof, and golden dragons speed the transmission.

In the year of the *Tai Sui* [X], the [X] month, the [X] day, this document is declared in [Prefecture], [Subprefecture], [County], [Village].

Inscribe in vermilion on a silver tally, wrap it in blue paper, and bind it with nine blue silk knots and one golden dragon. Bury it in the central palace of the dwelling.

Next, present the spirit tablet, inscribe the tablet, and bury it in the corresponding direction of the altar. Alternatively, cast it into mountain caves, deep springs, or abysses—let no one retrieve it.

Each tally is one foot two inches long, two inches four *fen* wide, and three *fen* thick.

The ritual offerings for ascending the altar are as follows:

Twenty-four thousand cash (or equivalent in bronze coins or treasures).
Nine taels of gold.
One bolt each of five-colored silk.

Five large mats.
Five sets of compounded incense, each set comprising two *dou* and five *sheng*.
Five incense burners.
A seven-chaptered table.
One crimson-patterned cloth.
One five-*chi* double-layered azure-patterned cloth.
One five-*chi* double-layered cloth with five-colored scattered floral patterns, one *dou* in quantity.
Life-destiny silk, its length matching the recipient’s age in *chi*.

For those born in the first or second month: their register belongs to the Azure Heaven, and their *qi* is linked to the Nine-*Qi* Heavenly Lords.
For those born in the fourth or fifth month: their register belongs to the Cinnabar Heaven, and their *qi* is linked to the Three-*Qi* Lords.
For those born in the seventh or eighth month: their register belongs to the White Heaven, and their *qi* is linked to the Seven-*Qi* Heavenly Lords.
For those born in the tenth or eleventh month: their register belongs to the Black Heaven, and their *qi* is linked to the Five-*Qi* Heavenly Lords.
For those born in the third, sixth, ninth, or twelfth month: their register belongs to the Yellow Heaven, and their *qi* is linked to the One-*Qi* Heavenly Lord.

According to the month of the ordination rite:
In the first or second month, state: “Now in the Three-*Qi* Heaven.”
In the fourth or fifth month, state: “Now in the Three-*Qi* Heaven.”
In the seventh or eighth month, state: “Now in the Seven-*Qi*.”
In the tenth or eleventh month, state: “Now in the Five-*Qi* Heaven.”
In the third, sixth, ninth, or twelfth month, state: “Now in the One-*Qi* Heaven.”

The *Taishang Dongxuan Lingbao Rite of Ordination* concludes.

The *Taishang Dongxuan Lingbao Rite of Ordination* states in the *Huanglu Jianwen Lingxian Section*:
Those who receive scriptures and methods must ordain nineteen disciples for the Three Masters, establishing merit and virtue so their names are recorded in the heavens. Only then may they ascend the altar to pledge alliance and receive the Five Elders’ Red Writ of the True Script in Jade Chapters, the Twenty-Four Perfected of the Three Divisions and Eight Sceneries, and the celestial steeds and offices of the Upper Perfected.
Those who fail to establish merit yet recklessly receive the Great Law will be seized by the Three Offices, facing bitter retribution in life and death, and examined by the Court of Illuminating the Law.

The *Mingzhen Code* states:
The pledge requires twenty-four thousand cash to secure the twenty-four *qi* life-officials.
If this solemn pledge is lacking, the gods of the Three Divisions and Eight Sceneries will not register the person’s destiny.
If gold cash is unavailable, bronze may be used as substitute.
If entirely lacking, the case is referred to the General Divine Bureau.

The *Mingzhen Code* states:
Five taels of refined gold are used to pledge the Five Marchmounts as a token of the precious scriptures.
The *Jade Decisions* states:
Nine taels of refined gold are offered to swear an oath to the Nine Heavens; deficiency incurs the penalty of disrespecting the scriptures.
The Five Marchmounts and sacred mountains will not register the learner’s name, and the case is referred to the Dark Bureau.

The *Mingzhen Code* states:
Forty *chi* of five-directional patterned silk are used to invoke the Five Thearchs as a token of the pledge.
If lacking, the Five Thearchs will not accept the person’s name, and the Five Thearch Demon-Kings will disrupt them, causing their resolve and thoughts to falter. The case is referred to the Water Bureau’s Springs and Bends Court.

The *Mingzhen Code* states:
Three gold dragons and three gold knots are cast into mountains, waters, or earth as a token of immortal study.
If not cast, the Three Offices will seize the person’s destiny register, and their prayers will not reach the heavens.
Violations are referred to the Nine Capitals Bureau.

The *Jade Key* states:
Tear five *chi* of Southern Harmony Elixir silk—crimson-patterned silk—to make a cloth for the altar table, upon which the *Five Chapters of the Numinous Treasure True Writ* and the Five Talismans are invoked.

The *Jade Key* states:
Cut five *chi* of Azure Grove silk—blue-patterned silk—to make a cloth to cover the True Writ and talismans.

The *Jade Key* states:
Place the True Writ and Five Talismans between the blue and crimson silks, forming a covenant of tonsure and blood-oath. The blue silk substitutes for hair, the crimson for the blood-oath; thus the perfected ones avoid harming their spirit and depleting their virtue.

The *Jade Key* states:
Five blended incenses—though the scripture does not specify the quantity, two *dou* and five *sheng* are customarily sufficient. Additionally, prepare one *dou* of five-colored mixed flowers, to be scattered in the ten directions during the perfected one’s ordination. Five large mats, a seven-patterned altar table, five incense burners with lidded boxes, and a lifespan silk matching the initiate’s age in *chi*.

The eight items above are used for the altar rites as tokens of the pledge.

The *Jade Key* states:
In spring, use *jiayin* and *yimao* days; in summer, *dingsi* and *bingwu*; during the four seasons, *wuchen*, *wuxu*, *jiwei*, and *jichou*; in autumn, *gengshen* and *xinyou*; in winter, *guihai* and *renzi*. Ascend the altar on the day of the establishing sovereign.

The *Jade Key* states:
Construct a high altar on a sacred peak, with railings on four sides. Open five gates at the east, west, south, north, and center, each marked with a placard bearing the following inscriptions:

**Nine Qi Azure Heaven, Peaceful Treasure Florescence Grove, Azure Numinous Primordial Elder Lord; Azure Thearch Lord; Nine Qi Azure Molar Heavenly Lord; Supreme Perfected Jade Azure Waist Jade Maiden; Eastern Quarter Spirits and Officials.**
*Azure Florescence Primordial Yang Gate.*
Inscribed in blue on red ground, placed above the eastern gate.

**Three Qi Cinnabar Heaven, Brahma Treasure Prosperous Yang, Cinnabar Numinous Perfected Elder Lord; Vermilion Thearch Lord; Vermilion Three Qi Heavenly Lord; Primordial Qi Elder; Vermilion Palace Supreme Cinnabar Jade Maiden; Southern Quarter Spirits and Officials.**
*Cavern Yang Supreme Radiance Gate.*
Inscribed in red on yellow ground, placed above the southern gate.

**Primordial Cavern Supreme Thearch, Heavenly Jade Treasure Primordial Numinous Elder Lord; Supreme Thearch Perfected One; Purple Cinnabar Yellow Court *Wu-Ji* Heaven Azure Jade Maiden; Central Yellow Great Thearch Official Lord.**
*Primordial Yellow Lofty Dawn Gate.*
Inscribed in yellow on white ground, placed above the central gate.

**Seven Qi White Heaven, Seven Treasures Golden Gate, Luminous Numinous August Elder Lord; White Thearch Lord; Bright Stone Seven Qi Grand Master; Supreme White Plain Jade Maiden; Western Quarter Spirits and Officials.**
*Passage Yin Golden Watchtower Gate.*
Inscribed in white on black ground, placed above the western gate.

**Five Qi Mysterious Heaven, Cavern Yin Northern Solitude, Profound Five Numinous Mysterious Elder Lord; Black Thearch Lord; Mysterious Nourishment Five Qi Heavenly Lord; Supreme Numinous Lord; Night Radiance Jade Maiden; Northern Quarter Spirits and Officials.**
*Yin Birth Vast Numinous Gate.*
Inscribed in black on blue ground, placed above the northern gate.

**Nine Heavens’ Multitudes of Spirits, Perfected Ones of the Five Marchmounts and Sacred Mountains, Spirits and Officials of the Three Offices and Nine Bureaus of the Rivers and Four Seas, Earth Immortals, Jade Maidens, Flying Immortals of the Five Marchmounts, and all Divine Immortal Lords.**
*Primordial Yellow Lofty Dawn Gate.*
Inscribed in purple on yellow ground, placed to the left of the central gate.

To the right, six placards are affixed above the five gates, with one placard each positioned at the eastern, western, southern, and northern gates according to their respective directions. Above the central gate, the symbols for *wu* and *ji* are displayed, while the two placards of the Nine Heavens are placed to the left and right of the gate. Five incense burners are arranged within the altar. Beneath the five tables, five-colored silken banners corresponding to the five directions are laid out. Additionally, a separate table is set at the center of the altar to receive the *True Writs* and the *Five Talismans Scripture*. Another table is prepared for submitting memorials and conducting rituals, making a total of seven tables. Gold and coin offerings are arrayed before the ritual table.

The *Yellow Register Simplified Writs* states: Those who receive the teachings must adhere to the luminous statutes, present their credentials to the master, and observe a seven-day fast. They shall submit a memorial on yellow silk, petitioning the heavens for the sacred texts. The altar is exposed to the open air for one night; if no wind stirs the *qi* and the writs remain unshaken, the candidate’s bone name is deemed fitting, and the transmission proceeds after the oath. If the wind disturbs the writs, the candidate must retreat and fast for three more days, then repeat the procedure as before. Should the wind disrupt the ritual three times, and the candidate lacks a celestial name or meritorious deeds, the Three Realms will not record them, the Five Thearchs will not protect them, their bone and *qi* will be deemed unfit, and the teachings shall not be lightly transmitted. This is examined and verified by the Bureau of Rectification.

The great oath of the *Numinous Treasure* requires the sacred writs to be exposed overnight. The sequence for presenting the memorial and invoking the officials is as follows:

Once the altar is established at the sacred mountain site, the master and disciple enter through the earthly portal, circling left. The master enters the inner altar’s royal gate, facing north to offer three pinches of incense. First, the two registers of the disciple’s received *True Writs* are placed upon the table. The disciple proceeds to the outer altar, faces south, turns north, and bows three times, prostrating to present the memorial. The master sounds the celestial drum thirty-six times. Next, the incense burner is kindled according to ritual, and the officials are invoked.

With reverence, the five visceral true officials and functionaries within this servant’s body are summoned forth; the flying immortals of the Three Caverns within this servant emerge—eleven each of the *Yin-Yang* Functionaries of the Upper Three Heavens, Enforcers of the Dao, Transformers of Civilization, Dispensers of the Way, Dissolvers of Disasters, Dispersers of Calamities, and Resolvers of Adversities. The high perfected officials governing this servant’s body, the *Great General of Established Authority and Surveillance of Merit* under the charge of so-and-so, the *Vanguard Effectors of Merit* and *Rearguard Effectors of Execution*, the *Commandant* and *Vice-Commandant of the Courier Court*, the *Fourfold Inspectors of Merit and Envoys*, the *Immortals and Numinous Direct Envoys* within this servant’s body, the *Orthodox Unity Functionaries*, the *Healing Functionaries*, the *Left and Right Palace Envoys*, the *Yin-Yang Spirit-Decision Officers*, the *Scarlet Talisman Chariot Officers*, the *Sturdy Wind Courier Post Riders*, and the *Memorial-Presenting Officers*—two each—emerge.

Those who emerge don their solemn regalia and ceremonial robes, caps and pendants, arraying their majestic presence. The *Direct Envoy Functionaries* wear the *Crown of Penetrating Heaven*, clad in black, holding unlined garments. The *Orthodox Unity Functionaries* don the *Crimson Yang Turbans* and vermilion unlined robes. The *Envoys* wear the *Nine-Virtue Caps* and five-colored *Longevity Unlined Robes*, girded with tiger-seal belts, left side bearing *Flowing Gold Fire Bells*, right side bearing the *Seven Origins of the Vast Expanse*, all grasping jade tablets.

The *Direct Envoy Functionaries* stand at the center; the *Healing Functionaries* guard and protect this servant’s body. The *Left Palace Envoys* hold banners at the fore; the *Right Palace Envoys* raise standards at the rear. The *Yang Spirit-Decision Officers* stand to the left; the *Yin Spirit-Decision Officers* stand to the right. The *Upper Functionaries* gaze afar toward the heavens; the *Middle Functionaries* survey the eight directions; the *Qi-Urging Functionaries* hasten the ten quarters; the *General Palace Envoys* encircle this servant’s body.

The *Tiger-Rushing Officials*, the *Inspectors of Treachery and Hook-Riding Generals*, the *Commanders of the Palace Servants*, the *Celestial Armored Soldiers*, the *Celestial Ding Warriors*, the *Qi-Gathering and Qi-Consuming Officers*, the *Spirit-Gathering and Spirit-Consuming Officers*, the *Ghost-Gathering and Ghost-Consuming Officers*, the *Essence-Gathering and Essence-Consuming Officers*, the *Toxin-Gathering and Toxin-Consuming Officers*, the *Evil-Gathering and Evil-Consuming Officers*, the *Talisman-Executing and Shrine-Destroying Officers*, the *Scarlet Talisman Chariot Officers*, the *Sturdy Wind Courier Post Riders*, the *Memorial-Presenting Officers*, and the *Flying Dragon Riders* take their stations before and behind this servant and retinue.

Once the *Left and Right Functionary Envoys* have completed their solemn preparations, they array the regalia and insignia, summoning the officials of the *Numinous Treasure*, the *Perfected Kings Overseeing the Retreat*, the *Attendants of the Canonical Scriptures*, the *Marshal Guardians of the Numinous*, the various lords, officials, generals, and functionaries of the Three Caverns, the twenty-four *Zhi* established by the Heavenly Master below, the thirty-six *Jing* hermitages, the seventy-two blessed lands, the three hundred sixty renowned mountains including Kunlun, and the over thirty-six thousand upper officials of the heavens. The sun, moon, and stellar lodges; the *Xuanji* and *Yuheng* constellations; the Five Thearchs of Heaven and Earth; the officials, lords, generals, and functionaries of the Three Realms; the *Two Mysteries*, *Three Origins*, *Four Beginnings*, and the *Qi*-infusing officials of the four directions, orientations, winds, and cyclical signs; the summoned *Nine Yi Hu Elders of the East*, the *Eight Man Yue Elders of the South*, the *Six Rong Shi Elders of the West*, the *Five Di Qiang Elders of the North*, the *Three Qin Cang Elders of the Center*; the lords of the Five Marchmounts, Four Waterways, hills, and marshes; the lords of all shrines, the *Meng* elders of high mountains and low valleys, forests and groves; the *Twelve Stream Women*; the original landlords of roots and sources; the generals and functionaries of the altars of soil and grain—all at once don their solemn regalia, joining the functionary envoys and *Flying Dragon Riders* within this servant’s body to ascend and address the *Supreme Venerable of the Mysterious Origin*, the *Supreme Lord of the Great Dao*, the *Supreme Elder*, the *Unsurpassed Mysterious Elder*, the *Celestial Worthies of the Ten Directions and Boundless Great Dao*, the *Virtuous and Perfect Great Thearchs*, the *Heavenly Thearchs*, the *Heavenly Masters*, the *Female Masters*, the *Three Masters*, the *Lords and Ladies*, their attendants handling the twelve documents, those who process memorials and manage affairs—this servant humbly entrusts to them the *Numinous Treasure Great Rites*, the *Numinous True Writs*, the *Two Registers of the Eight Effulgences’ Inner Sounds*, and the *Yellow Plain Memorial*—one set placed upon the jade table, respectfully submitted for perusal.

The summoning of the officials is complete. Next, the memorial is read aloud.

Next, the solemn reaffirmation of the charge.

The true officials of the five constituents within this servant’s body, each with their minor clerks and the twelve document handlers, shall don their ceremonial attire—crowns, sashes, and pendent tassels—and promptly present this servant’s memorial of the revealed and true scriptural texts, ascending to the Supreme Lord’s court to submit and respond according to the matter at hand. Should any character be miswritten, let it be corrected; should any be omitted, let it be supplied. If words are inverted or disordered, pursue and rectify them, ensuring all conforms to the highest standard, so that no superior office may reprove or reject it. Let the host of demons of the Six Heavens and the residual qi of subordinate offices sever and intercept the official documents no longer; let them distinguish and transmit the memorials in due course, that they may ascend and be reported in time. Then, rise and face north, strike the teeth nine times, and invoke:

O Most High Primordial Origin, Spiritually Venerable of the Nine Heavens,
Supreme Perfected of the Mysterious Beyond, whose Dao abides in the jade pavilion,
As the Three and Five revolve and the Seven Luminaries alter the dawn,
The Void Sovereign reins in the chariot, the Five Thearchs ordain transcendence.
The Azure Palace gathers the verdant, the talismanic mandate issues from the numinous mountain.
On this day of primal auspiciousness, the myriad perfected open the array.
The initiates of ranks Jia and Yi, bound by karmic conditions of former lives,
Have encountered the divine scriptures, the precious chapters of the Supreme Thearch.
Reverently, upon the Mysterious Peak, they pledge alliance with the Nine Heavens,
Proclaiming below to the Five Thearchs and the twelve river sources,
Beseeching registration and receipt, to memorialize the exalted court above,
Universally announcing to the ten thousand spirits, arraying the ranks upon the imperial altar.
Let the guard and defense of the majestic ritual proceed as ordained by the Supreme Perfected.
The transmission shall await the dawn’s report.

Next, the officials are dismissed.
The *Merit Clerk Messengers* within this servant’s body, the *Register’s Generals and Clerks*, and the *Officials for Memorializing Above*—having fulfilled their duties—shall return into this servant’s body, those on the left to the left, those on the right to the right, securely abiding within the nine palaces and six repositories, the golden hall and jade chamber, the twelve mechanisms of the passes, coiling about the body and winding through the bones, safeguarding the hundred meridians. Should any overseer be charged with protecting this servant’s body, let the *Merit Clerks* sequentially inspect and verify, allowing no errors or omissions, until this servant summons them forth again, whereupon they shall act as before.

Sound the ritual drum three times, swallow the qi three times.
Then rise, bow twice, and replenish the incense burner according to the proper method.
When complete, the master and disciples exit through the earthly portal.

The next day, ascend the altar to proclaim the great alliance in due order.
At dawn, declare the completion of the merit. If the disciples are numerous, rearrange the altar as before.
Use six placards, placing them upon the five gates: one each at the eastern, southern, western, and northern gates according to their positions; at the royal gate, affix the *Wu-Ji* and *Nine Heavens* placards to the left and right of the gate.
The formula states: The central gate lies below the main gate at the *Ji* position—like *Chou* in spring; the gate of the assembled perfected lies above the main gate at the *Meng* position—like *Si* in spring. The rest follow accordingly.
If the disciples are few, use the fasting altar, adhering to the standard method of the *Yellow Register* fast.
Further adorn and purify the arrangement, ensuring all is meticulously prepared.
All requisite items for ascending the altar shall be fully assembled. Sound the bell, and the Dharma Master with the disciples approach the altar.
The *Three Masters* and *Five Guarantors*, clad in solemn ritual vestments, and the disciples, all in dark caps and yellow-brown robes, holding tablets and maintaining reverent order, with incense, flowers, and invocations, shall proceed entirely according to the proper method.

First, lead the disciples in circumambulating the altar three times, halting at the southeastern corner, facing west, and chanting the invocations without cease.
Next, lead the master in circumambulating the altar three times, halting at the northwestern corner.
The master withdraws thirty paces from the altar—or seven paces—then strikes the teeth thirty-two times, visualizing purple clouds veiling the crown.
For one altar or one mountain, the divine soldiers of the Five Thearchs, each one hundred thousand strong, come to receive this servant’s body, vivid and distinct.
Then invoke:

As the divine perfected set forth on their journey,
The myriad thearchs are startled,
The jade void’s mysterious guard,
The celestial lodges overturn.
The officials of the Five Peaks, none fail to lend their numinous aid.
Commanding the ten directions, driving the celestial soldiers,
Leading them from heaven below, all assemble at the imperial court,
That I may ascend to transcendence, penetrating the essence of the Dao.
Discerning what is inauspicious, plumbing the obscure and profound,
All that is directed and declared shall wholly accord with the Jade Purity.

When finished, ascend the altar slowly, entering through the northwestern celestial gate. Invoke according to the proper method.
Ascend to the central altar, circling left to face northwest, and bow nine times toward the Lord of the Nine Heavens. Having completed the obeisance, strike the teeth nine times and invoke:

This servant [Name] now transmits to disciple [Name] the precious scriptures of the Nine Heavens, the supreme jade taboo names. Having purified the fast and submitted the nocturnal memorial, with qi and destiny harmonized with the true, beseech the *Jade Perfected of the Lower Realm*, the *Attendant Gentleman of Records*, and the *Marshal of Numinous Guardians* to descend and oversee the alliance documents, as well as all that has been initiated and entrusted, that it may all ascend and be heard above.

Circumambulate the altar to the left, returning to face southeast, and bow twice.
Then proclaim:

The Most High Primordial Heavenly King, on this day we present the eightfold vows at the auspicious hour, reverently at the Dark Altar—or Mount of the Sacred Peak. We transmit the *Alliance Scripture of the Dark Mystery*, beseeching the Five Divine Mountains of the Emperors to descend and oversee this servant’s oath, that we may swiftly be granted immortality, ascend on flying chariots, and rise to the Imperial Dawn.

Having completed this, the Dharma Master leans forward, then commands the disciple to enter the central altar through the southeastern earthly gate, facing northwest to bow nine times. When finished, the Master circumambulates left to stand at the earthly gate, while the disciple circumambulates left to stand at the heavenly gate, turning to face southeast. They bow twice, then prostrate facing north with heads to the south. The Master turns to face north, strikes the teeth thirty-six times, and recites the *Golden Perfected Vast Emptiness Chapter* to subdue the myriad demons. Its words are:

Heavenly demons surge through the void,
Myriad spirits startle the divine court.
Assuming forms in songs and chants,
They shift and enter the nameless.
How clamorous their chaotic qi,
Defiling the Way as they arise along the path.
Within the clouds they dwell in crimson palaces,
While the Northern Emperor deploys his divine troops.
The drum’s resonance knows its own course,
The Dark Mandate comes to summon them.
The Upper Radiance reins the flying steeds,
Swift chariots inspect the cloud encampments.
Hastening the Northern Emperor’s records,
They seize and bind the names of the demon hordes.
The *Huoluo* unfurls the celestial nets,
Unleashing might and casting the ringing bells.
The Golden Perfected aids the hollow vastness,
Jade light illumines the eight darknesses.
The Golden Mystery guards the Upper Palace,
Divine tigers slay the celestial essences.
Severing the qi of the ten thousand perils,
All countless billions are pacified as one.
Upholding the Nine Heavens’ trust,
Their whistled commands leave none unbowed.
Summoning the Perfected to fathom the Three Caverns,
Wisdom’s recitation shines with clarity.
The Eight Paths gaze upon the Dark Text,
Seven revolutions weave the Heavenly Scripture.
Merging with the Imperial Unity of the One True,
Delivering the seven generations of ancestors.
Eradicating the roots of the five sufferings,
Returning souls to receive renewed glory.
Golden light blazes in the chamber of stillness,
Divine candles kindle of themselves.
Fragrant blossoms scatter through the Jade Universe,
Misty qi penetrates the Jade Capital.
The Emperor dispatches his lingering chariot,
The Three Origins descend in green carriages.
Swift steeds soar through the Nine Mysteries,
Attending our court in the Jade Emperor’s palace.

When finished, they circumambulate left, the disciple following the Master through the heavenly gate into the inner altar—or entering through the heavenly gate. They circumambulate left, then offer incense to the five directions, beginning in the east and circling back to the west, facing east. The Dharma Master closes his eyes, inwardly visualizing and perceiving the five viscera, five sacred peaks, five stars, and five emperors, all guarding within his body, their radiance covering him as one. His body becomes golden, emerging from behind the lungs, his neck crowned with a halo like the sun, illuminating the ten directions. Within his body, all is clearly seen, both inside and out.

Then he recites the invocation to the Guardian Spirit of Numinous Might:

Nine Qi of the Azure Heavens, Radiant Star Great Spirit,
Shining upon the eastern quarter, illuminating the nine gates,
Turning like a candle’s yang-light, sweeping away filth and banishing miasma.
Luminous Youth, guard my chariot,
Seizing demons and binding evil, ascending to face the Imperial Lord,
Upholding the true Dao, the vermilion script and jade texts,
The talismanic commands of the Nine Heavens, borne by dragon couriers,
Pacifying and securing all under heaven—
Thus I attain flight as an immortal.

South: Cinnabar Heaven of Three Qi, streaming with light,
The gleaming star turns like a candle, illuminating the Great Yang.
Above dwells the Crimson Essence, Luminous Youth of Spirit,
Commanding the hosts of fire, guarding the Three Palaces,
Severing evil and binding demons, shearing away demon kings.
Empowered by the Northern Emperor, the Eight Thrusts of Wind and Fire,
Interlocking bells blaze in radiance.
Should any dare disobey, the true Dao flows forth—
I partake of supreme merit, preserving heaven’s enduring existence,
For kalpas unending.

Heaven of Seven Qi, where Venus streams with essence,
Its light illumines the Golden Gate, brightening the Great Darkness.
Within dwells the White Sovereign, named Imperial Spirit,
Preserving and pacifying the numinous, guarding my form,
Cutting off the roots of evil, the kingly Dao shines forth in rectitude.
Palaces and dwellings stand ordered, the Three Luminaries aligned as one.
The Dao harmonizes with spontaneity—
I ascend in flight to the Purple Court,
By the talismanic commands of the Numinous Treasure, universally benefiting all beings.
Merit extends to all, heaven and earth attain tranquility.

North: Mysterious Heaven of Five Qi, circling in procession,
The Morning Star blazes resplendent, its light illumining the Supreme Subtlety.
Black Numinous Honored Spirit, clad in flying dark feathers,
Guards the five gates, inspecting essences and seizing transgressors.
Should any dare challenge, the Vast and Falling Blade severs and shatters.
By the jade talisman’s decree, the Eight Might of the Divine,
The gates of evil are sealed, the true Dao shines forth in clarity,
Illuminating my body, the Three Lights gleam as one.
I spur the void and ride the floating clouds, my form ascending in immortal flight.

Yellow Center governs qi, unifying the mysterious and true,
Saturn emits its radiance, streaming and blazing through the Nine Heavens.
Twelve Luminous Youths, primordial qi and yang essence,
Flames rise in crimson smoke, together illuminating this chamber and my body.
A hundred evils are shattered, ten thousand ghosts slain.
The divine incantation of Mount Zhong spreads universally—
The Five Numinous Ones pacify and secure, my body ascends as an immortal.

Next, strike the teeth twenty-four times.

Next, kindle the incense burner and recite the invocation:
Most High Three Heavens, Primordial Origin, Three Qi, Supreme Venerable Lord Lao,
Summon forth from my body the Three and Five Merit Officials, the left and right attendants,
The left and right incense-bearing dragon couriers, the Jade Lads who tend incense,
The Jade Maidens who scatter flowers, the Five Emperors’ Direct Talisman and Direct Day Incense Officials—
Each thirty-six in number—
To emerge and report to the local earth deities and territorial spirits of this place.
I now, in this moment, burn incense and transmit the teachings,
Praying that the life-breath of the Most High’s Ten Directions and True Perfected Ones descend and infuse my body,
That my supplications swiftly ascend, directly presented before the True and Boundless Dao.

Next, the Master leads the disciple in circumambulating left, holding the petition tablet, facing west toward the east, and intoning the Heavenly Worthy of the East—each direction receiving three bows.
Alternatively, one bow may suffice, or the tablet may be omitted, simply intoning the directions in sequence.

Next, the South; then the West; then the North; then the Northeast; then the Southeast; then the Southwest; then the Northwest; then the Upper Realm; then the Lower Realm—each performed in the same manner.

We, with utmost sincerity, submit ourselves to the Boundless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the East,
The Azure Emperor, Lord of the Nine Qi of Heaven, and all the spirit officials of the eastern quarter.
[Disciple’s name and lineage] reverently presents this petition.
The same for all ten directions.

With utmost sincerity, we submit ourselves to the Boundless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the South,
The Flaming Emperor, Lord of the Three Qi of Heaven, and all the spirit officials of the southern quarter.

With utmost sincerity, we submit ourselves to the Boundless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the West,
The White Emperor, Lord of the Seven Qi of Heaven, and all the spirit officials of the western quarter.

With utmost sincerity, we submit ourselves to the Boundless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the North,
The Black Emperor, Lord of the Five Qi of Heaven, and all the spirit officials of the northern quarter.

With utmost sincerity, we submit ourselves to the Boundless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Northeast,
The Lord of the Primordial Azure Qi of Heaven, and all the spirit officials of the northeastern quarter.

With utmost sincerity, we submit ourselves to the Boundless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Southeast,
The Lord of the Primordial Cinnabar Qi of Heaven, and all the spirit officials of the southeastern quarter.

With utmost sincerity, we submit ourselves to the Boundless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Southwest,
The Lord of the Primordial White Qi of Heaven, and all the spirit officials of the southwestern quarter.

With utmost sincerity, we submit ourselves to the Boundless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Northwest,
The Lord of the Primordial Mysterious Qi of Heaven, and all the spirit officials of the northwestern quarter.

With utmost sincerity, we submit ourselves to the Boundless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Upper Realm at the Heavenly Gate,
The Celestial Capital of the Mysterious Metropolis, the Golden Watchtower of the Seven Treasures, the Purple Tenuity Palace of the Supreme Palace of the Thirty-Two Heavens,
The Heavenly Worthy of the Flying Brahma and Great Brahma Heavens, the Perfected Ones and Jade Maidens, and all the spirit officials of the upper realm.

With utmost sincerity, we submit ourselves to the Boundless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthy of the Lower Realm at the Earthly Gate,
The August Sovereign of the Nine Lands, the Four Controllers and Five Emperors, the Yin-Yang Water Bureau and Twelve Immortal Officials,
The Heavenly Worthies of the Thirty-Six Earthly Primes of the Cavernous Abyss, Cavernous Void, and Cavernous Origin,
And all the spirit officials of the earthly realm.

With utmost sincerity, I, your servant, now follow the covenants of the Supreme Perfected and the precepts of the fast,
Ascending the altar, preparing the implements.
At the appointed hour yesterday, I presented the memorial to the numinous worthies,
Awaiting with sincere devotion in the jasper pavilion, the assembled spirits taking their places.
Thus the rains have ceased on this auspicious day, the winds stilled in this clear hour,
Extending through the Ten Heavens, the Three Qi streaming with light,
Majestic forms spreading like clouds, the supreme rites unfolding.
I, [disciple’s name], am profoundly fortunate, having aroused the causes most difficult to fulfill,
Presumptuously hoping for fruits most difficult to attain.
Diligently following the Dharma, I transmit the talismans from beginning to end,
Praying to avoid wind and rain, that after receiving them, I may proceed without hindrance.

Each kowtows and strikes the cheeks.

Next, with utmost sincerity, the Dharma Master takes his position, facing east, while the disciple returns to face east, prostrating westward on the ground.
The Dharma Master kneels lengthily and again strikes the teeth twenty-four times.

Summoning the officials:

And the twenty-four Flying Heavenly Immortal Officials of the Three Caverns, Eight Effulgences, and Eight Palaces of the Numinous Treasure and Cavernous Mystery—
Each twenty-four in number—to emerge.

From the Three Caverns and Eight Effulgences of the Cavernous Heavens emerge the Flying Spontaneous Numinous Treasure Perfected Immortals and Jade Maidens of Flower Scattering—twenty-four each.
From the Three Caverns, Eight Effulgences, and Thirty-Two Heavens of the Cavernous Heavens emerge the Flying Numinous Treasure Five Emperors’ Direct Talismans—twenty-four each.

They bear nine-colored standards, hold tablets and banners, grasp the tokens of spirit-summoning, and command the pennants of demonic and numinous forces. From the Great Mystery’s Three Caverns and Eight Effulgences of the Cavernous Heavens emerge the Spontaneous Numinous Treasure Perfected Immortals and Flying Celestial Officers of the Southern Marchmount Vermilion Thearch, Masters of the Charts—twenty-four each.
