Then the disciple turns left, faces south, while the master turns left to face north, and kneels lengthily. Thirty-six strikes of the drum are sounded. The Most High Numinous Treasure Supreme Cavern Mystery Dharma Master, so-and-so, your servant Yue so-and-so bows twice with head reverently lowered, and respectfully invokes the Celestial Canon Attendants of the Supreme Ultimate, the Jade Scribes of the Scriptural Bureau, the Inspector-Marshal of Ordination, the Four Directors and Five Thearchs, the Jade Lads and Jade Maidens, who grasp purple-feathered tablets and tenfold numinous banners, leading ten thousand spirits and a thousand perfected ones, with phoenix flutes sounding before them and celestial harmonies played behind, burning incense and scattering flowers as they descend together through the void. Heavenly ranks arrayed, they witness the ordination and the sworn covenant.

Your servant, relying upon the perfected immortals and transcendent officials, the flying dragon couriers, humbly addresses the Most High Boundless Dao, the Most High Lord of the Dao, the Primordial Origin’s Five Venerable Thearchs, the Numinous Treasure Primordial Honored One, the Ten Directions’ Spontaneously Arisen Perfected, the Four Quarters’ Great Sages, the Golden Watchtower Thearch, the Supreme Ultimate Perfected, the Three Perfected of the Most High Mysterious Unity, and the host of venerable ones beneath the Jade Towers of the Clear Mystery: your servant, base and foolish, a walking corpse of foul flesh, by accumulated fortune and karmic convergence, has encountered the true scriptures and been granted the honor of receiving the Three Caverns’ precious texts. The Dao is lofty, its principles subtle—far beyond what I can bear. Day and night I tremble in fear, my form and soul never at rest. Your servant, in utmost trepidation, kowtows again and again, prostrate with mortal transgression, prostrate with mortal transgression.

Your servant, unworthy and presumptuous, dares to offer these words. Reverently examining the august scriptures, so profound and weighty, their traces deep and their sources abstruse, they are truly not something a humble servant may presume to expound. Moreover, the luminous statutes and canonical regulations decree that transmission may only occur after five or eight hearings. Your servant has but newly received the Dharma and is unfit to proclaim it openly. Yet as the great kalpa nears its end, the world’s span shortens, fortune and misfortune alternate, and the Dao requires that the loyal and worthy be broadly initiated into the Dharma gate. Though the hearts of people today are shallow and false, truth and deceit difficult to discern, still those who sincerely aspire—though their merit be slight—may be recognized. If they diligently seek and their sincerity reaches, they must not be shut out.

Your servant, having previously presented a memorial above, now respectfully reports that the Perfected of such-and-such an Imperial Realm, so-and-so, is by nature compassionate and kind, his character pure and unsullied, his aspirations lofty, disdaining glory and splendor. He delights in emptiness and savors the true, yearning for immortality and revering the divine. He has followed the teachings of the Great Vehicle’s supreme Dharma, exhorting and guiding others, establishing virtue and merit, devoutly enduring hardship, tirelessly striving, drilling and toiling for years on end, his resolve fixed upon the source of the Dao. Now he presents golden silks and precious tokens, the requisites for receiving the true, swearing before the assembled ministers with his nine ancestors as witnesses, seeking to bear the Numinous Treasure’s Primordial Origin Five Venerable Thearchs’ Vermilion Script of True Writs and Precious Talismans, the twenty-four Perfected Divine Officials and Soldiers of the Three Divisions and Eight Sceneries, the Jade Characters of the Inner Sounds of the Heavens, the Eight Might Command Texts, the divine staff, and all other matters as your servant has witnessed.

So-and-so’s bone nature and resolve are fitting for accomplishment. Reverently following the ancient canons of the Luminous Perfected, a ritual arena is established, covenants are sworn before the Nine Heavens, and the transmission is conferred in accordance with the statutes. Let it be treasured as his personal jewel, never to be betrayed, lightly divulged, or treated with negligence, lest he sever his roots and destroy his lineage, his parents in life and death, and his own person, suffering the trials of the wind-blade and enduring ten thousand kalpas without reprieve. May the Most High Host of Venerables, the Ten Directions’ Sage Perfected, and the Four Directors and Five Thearchs clearly witness this sworn covenant. Respectfully submitted for your august consideration and enactment. Your servant, in utmost trepidation, bows twice with head reverently lowered.

Then the Dharma Master concludes the invocation. Thereupon he rises, and the disciple follows behind the master, offering incense thrice to the Five Directions, beginning in the east. At each direction, he kneels lengthily to present the incense. When the circuit is complete, he paces three times around the altar and scatters flowers in the ten directions. At that time, the Five Perfected Ones’ hymns of praise are chanted in full. The disciple bows twice and intones the benediction.

The Hymn of the Supreme Ultimate Perfected One:
The Most High Lord of the Great Dao
Revealed the Numinous Treasure Scriptures.
Sublime and wondrous, beyond compare,
Like the mystery within mystery.
The spontaneous, non-actional Dao—
Those who study it ascend as high immortals.
Vast is the Cavernous Void Scripture,
Seated in peace, they attend the heavens.
Above, it treasures the Purple Tenuity Terrace,
Below, it conceals the famed mountains.
Resplendent with dragon and phoenix patterns,
Its radiance gleams in the spaceless.
Wondrous is the Most High Dao,
Non-action, ever spontaneous.
Kings, lords, and common folk—
All esteem only the loyal and worthy.
Those with karmic fortune from past lives,
Outstanding from former causes,
Masters transmit it in succession,
Precious tokens through kalpas of years.
Broadly mindful of delivering all,
Great fortune repays your person.
Those who make offerings will attain the Dao,
Those who uphold it become perfected immortals.
The Great Dao has no self or other—
Transmission must find its proper recipient.

The Hymn of the First Perfected of the Most High Mysterious Unity:
From the Cavern Perfected emerge all wonders,
Resplendent, illuminating the Great Clarity.
Those who uphold it are called immortals,
Their bodies eternally enduring.
Carefree, they sport in the mysterious void,
Palaces arrayed beyond form.
Lush and radiant, the Seven Treasures Grove,
Luminous as the sun and moon’s essence.
Dragon scales intertwine in flight,
Phoenixes soar with mournful cries.
The Most High governs the Purple Terrace,
The host of perfected chant the Cavern Scripture.
Burning incense, they bow in reverence,
Circling the palace city.
Three circuits return to the high seat,
The Dao King responds in kind.
Should the lord of men magnify the supreme Dao,
The world will be universally at peace.

The Hymn of the Second Perfected of the Most High Mysterious Unity:
Emptiness and constancy, ever spontaneous,
Forcibly named the Great Dao.
Vast and boundless, without limit,
All wonders return to the Numinous Treasure.
Closing the eyes, one contemplates the Perfected,
With concentrated thought, the Ten Venerables descend.
Ascending as immortals, forever non-active,
Their numinous countenances eternally wondrous.
Thirst quenched with jade pool nectar,
Hunger sated with golden radiance herbs.
Serene wisdom transcends the eight difficulties,
Delivering the world from all suffering and affliction.

The Hymn of the Third Perfected of the Most High Mysterious Unity:
Wondrous are the Numinous Treasure Scriptures,
The Most High’s spontaneous texts.
Those who uphold them attain immortality,
Called the true Heavenly Honored Ones.
Charged with proclaiming the Dao’s teachings,
Truly they surpass worldly talent.
Their tasks complete, they ascend as divine immortals,
Their palaces govern the Mysterious Terrace.
At times they descend Mount Kunlun,
Carefree, they rest on Penglai.

The Hymn of the Most High Orthodox Unity Perfected, the Three Heavens’ Great Dharma Celestial Master:
The Numinous Treasure and the Great Cavern—
The supreme king of the true Dao scriptures.

chunks.original_text: 如有五千文，高妙无等双。 奉行立飞仙，玄居治虚空。 侍卫太上台，逍遥紫微宫。 万劫犹电顷，长存永无穷。 道眼已备足，豁落自冥通。 幽昧无不知，安坐观十方。 诵毕，法师弟子各还复位，南北相对，披真文於案上。 师诵真文序毕，弟子再礼，次依玉诀正音，字字解说，口授读度。 弟子承受诀言，东方安宝华林青灵始老九炁青天赤书真文。 东方赤书玉篇 东方九炁，始皇青天，碧霞郁垒，中有老人，总校图绿，摄炁举仙，岁星辅肝，角亢镇真，氏房心尾，四景回旋，箕主七辰，玉斗明轮，承炁捕非，扫除灾群，东山神咒，摄召九天，赤书符命，制会酆山，束魔送鬼，所诛无镯，悉诣木宫，敢有稽延，下制东河，溟海水神，大劫洪灾，蛟龙负身，水府开道，通径百千，青帝赤文，风火无间。 南方赤书玉篇 南方丹天，赤帝玉堂，中有大神，号曰赤皇，上炎流烟，三炁勃光，神仙受命，应运太阳，荧惑辅心，井鬼守房，柳星张翼，抗御四乡，轸总七宿，回转天常，召运促会，正道驿行，赤文命灵，北摄酆山，束送魔宗，斩灭邪原，符教所诛，明列罪源，南山神咒，威伏万方，群祆灭爽，万试摧亡，南河水帝，太伯龙王，神咒流行，普扫不祥，洪水飞灾，止蛟召龙，开除水径，千道万通，敢有干试，摄送火宫，赤书所告，莫有不从。 中央赤书玉篇 中央总灵，黄上天元，始生五老，中黄高尊，摄炁监真，总领群仙，典录玄图，宿简玉文，催运上炁，普告万神，镇星辅脾，回度北元，魁魁主非，截邪斩奸，魑魉魑魅，扫秽除氛，魒正玄斗，明度天关，九天符命，金马驿传，勅摄北帝，遏塞鬼门，剪除不祥，莫有当前，中山神咒，召龙上云，制会黄河，九水河源，不得殆纵，善恶悉分，千祆万奸，上对帝君，莫有干试，太阳激愤，赤书玉字，宣告普闻。 西方赤书玉篇 西方素天，白帝七门，金灵皓映，太华流氛，白石峨峨，七炁烟煴，上有始生，皇老大神，总领肺黑，主校九天，检定图录，制召上仙，太白检肺，奎娄守魂，胃昴毕觜，主制七关，参总斗魁，受符北元，赤书玉字，九天正文，摄召万炁，普归帝君，西山神咒，八威七传，符水上龙，召山送云，在所校录，同到帝门，辅卫上真，斩灭邪源，若有不祥，截以金关，赤书符命，风火驿传。 北方黑帝赤书玉篇 北方玄天，五炁徘徊，中有黑帝，双皇太微，总领符命，仙炼八威，青裙羽属，龙文凤衣，上帝所举，制到玉阶，北辰辅肾，斗牛卫扉，女虚危室，豁落四开，辟总七星，执凶纠非，却灾扫秽，明道洞辉，北山神咒，激阳起雷，流铃焕落，玃天振威，北酆所部，万祆灭摧，九河倾讫，鸟母群飞，蛟龙通道，水陌洞开，赤文玉书，驿龙风驰。 五魔玉讳 九炁天中空洞青灵魔王，姓巴元，讳丑伯。 三炁天中空洞赤灵魔王，姓负天，讳担石。 中黄高皇天中空洞黄灵魔王，姓横天，讳担力。 七炁天中空洞白灵魔王，姓反山，讳六目。 五炁天中空洞黑灵魔王，姓监丑，讳朗馥。 度上部八景 清微天主上部赤字玉诀

Should one possess the five thousand characters,
Lofty and wondrous, peerless in the world,
Their practice establishes ascent to immortality,
Dwelling in mystery, they govern the void.
They attend and guard the Terrace of the Most High,
Carefree, they wander the Purple Tenuity Palace.
Ten thousand kalpas pass like a flash of lightning,
Yet they endure, ever without end.
The Dao-eye now fully complete,
Vast and unobstructed, they commune with the unseen.
The obscure and dim hold no secrets,
Seated in stillness, they observe the ten directions.

When the recitation concludes, the Dharma Master’s disciples each return to their positions, facing north and south, and unfold the true script upon the altar. The Master recites the preface to the true script, after which the disciples bow again. Then, following the jade instructions, they articulate the correct pronunciation, explaining each character and transmitting the oral transmission for recitation.

The disciples receive the oral instructions:
In the East, establish the Treasure Florescence Grove of the Azure Numinous Beginning Elder and the Nine Qi Azure Heaven’s Red Script.

**Red Script Jade Chapter of the East**
The East’s Nine Qi, the Primordial Sovereign Azure Heaven,
Verdant mists rise in layered ranks,
Within dwells the Elder,
Who oversees the celestial charts and records,
Directs qi to elevate immortals,
With Jupiter aiding the liver,
Horn and Neck stars anchoring the true,
Root, Chamber, Heart, and Tail revolve in fourfold harmony,
Winnowing Basket governs the seven luminaries,
The Jade Dipper shines in radiant wheel,
Receiving qi to capture transgressions,
Sweeping away calamities in throngs.
The Eastern Mountain’s divine incantation
Summons the Nine Heavens,
The Red Script’s talismanic mandate
Commands Fengdu’s assembly.
Binding demons and dispatching ghosts,
None slain escape unscathed,
All are consigned to the Wooden Palace.
Should any dare delay,
They are subdued beneath the Eastern River,
The spirits of the briny deep,
When great kalpas bring deluge,
Dragons bear the burden,
The Water Palace opens its paths,
A thousand roads and myriad passages clear.
The Azure Emperor’s Red Script,
Wind and fire move without pause.

**Red Script Jade Chapter of the South**
The South’s Cinnabar Heaven,
The Crimson Emperor’s Jade Hall,
Within dwells a great deity,
Named the Crimson Sovereign.
Flaming mists rise in streams,
Three qi surge with radiant light.
Immortals receive their mandate,
In accord with the Great Yang’s movement.
Mars aids the heart,
Well and Ghost guard the Chamber,
Willow, Star, Spread, and Wing
Resist the four quarters.
Chariot Wheel governs the seven lodges,
Revolving the celestial constant.
Summoning and hastening convergence,
The true Dao’s courier routes proceed.
The Red Script’s numinous command
Northward seizes Fengdu,
Binding and dispatching demonic lineages,
Severing the roots of evil.
Those slain by talismanic decree
Are exposed in their crimes’ origins.
The Southern Mountain’s divine incantation
Subdues the ten thousand directions,
All malevolent spirits perish utterly,
Ten thousand trials crumble to naught.
The Southern River’s Water Emperor,
The Great Elder Dragon King,
The divine incantation flows forth,
Universally sweeping away misfortune.
Floods and flying disasters,
Halting dragons and summoning serpents,
Clearing waterways,
A thousand paths and myriad passages open.
Should any dare defy,

**Red Script Jade Chapter of the Center**
The Center’s sovereign numen,
The Yellow Supreme Heaven’s Origin,
First engendering the Five Elders,
The Central Yellow’s exalted honor.
Directing qi and overseeing the true,
They govern the host of immortals,
Custodians of the mysterious charts,
Keepers of the jade texts in the celestial archives.
Hastening the descent of primordial qi,
Universally announcing to the myriad spirits.
Saturn aids the spleen,
Revolving the Northern Origin’s cycles.
Dipper and Straddler suppress transgressions,
Severing evil and cutting treachery.
Goblins and specters,
Sweeping filth and dispelling miasma.
The Demon-Queller and the Mystic Dipper
Illuminate and traverse Heaven’s Pass.
The Nine Heavens’ talismanic mandate,
Transmitted by the Golden Horse’s couriers.
They command and seize the Northern Emperor,
Sealing the Ghost Gate,
Excising misfortune,
None dare stand before them.
The Central Mountain’s divine incantation
Summons dragons to ascend the clouds,
Commanding the Yellow River’s assembly,
The Nine Waters’ sources.
No laxity or indulgence permitted,
Good and evil are fully distinguished.
A thousand demons and ten thousand villains,
All face the Celestial Lord’s judgment.
None dare defy,
The Great Yang’s wrath aroused,
The Red Script’s jade characters
Proclaimed for all to hear.

**Red Script Jade Chapter of the West**
The West’s Pale Heaven,
The White Emperor’s Seven Gates,
Golden numen gleams in purity,
Great Flower’s mists drift in luminous haze.
White stones tower in majesty,
Seven qi waft in smoky splendor.
Above dwells the Primordial Elder,
The August Elder, great deity,
Who governs the lungs and the black,
Overseeing the Nine Heavens,
Inspecting and verifying the celestial records,
Commanding and summoning the exalted immortals.
Venus aids the lungs,
Straddler and Mound guard the hun-soul,
Stomach, Pleiades, Net, and Turtle Beak
Govern the seven passes.
Triad and Dipper-Straddler
Receive the Northern Origin’s talismans,
The Red Script’s jade characters,
The Nine Heavens’ true texts.
Summoning the myriad qi,
Universally returning to the Celestial Lord.
The Western Mountain’s divine incantation,
Eight Might and Seven Transmissions,
Talismanic water upon dragons,
Summoning mountains and dispatching clouds.
All are recorded and inspected,
Together arriving at the Celestial Gate.
Aiding and guarding the exalted perfected,
Severing and extinguishing evil’s roots.
Should misfortune arise,
It is cut off by the Golden Pass.
The Red Script’s talismanic mandate,
Transmitted by wind and fire couriers.

**Red Script Jade Chapter of the Black Emperor of the North**
The North’s Mysterious Heaven,
Five qi meander in cycles,
Within dwells the Black Emperor,
The Twin Sovereigns of the Great Tenuity.
They govern talismanic mandates,
Immortals refine the Eight Might,
Clad in azure skirts and feathered robes,
Dragon-script and phoenix-embroidered garments.
Raised by the Supreme Emperor,
Their commands reach the Jade Stairs.
The Northern Asterism aids the kidneys,
Dipper and Oxguard the gates,
Maiden, Void, Rooftop, and Encampment
Open the four quarters in vast clarity.
Straddler governs the seven stars,
Seizing the inauspicious and rectifying transgressions,
Repelling calamities and sweeping filth,
Illuminating the Dao in resplendent brilliance.
The Northern Mountain’s divine incantation
Stirs the yang to summon thunder,
Flowing bells gleam and fall,
The Heavenly Ape shakes its might.
Fengdu’s legions,
Ten thousand malevolent spirits utterly destroyed,
The Nine Rivers overturned,
Bird mothers and their flocks take flight,
Dragons clear the paths,
Waterways open in luminous passage.
The Red Script’s jade texts,
Transmitted by dragon couriers in wind’s swift flight.

**Jade Taboos of the Five Demons**
In the Nine Qi Heaven’s hollow emptiness, the Azure Numinous Demon King, surnamed Ba Yuan, personal name Chou Bo.
In the Three Qi Heaven’s hollow emptiness, the Crimson Numinous Demon King, surnamed Fu Tian, personal name Dan Shi.

chunks.original_text: 青书玉字，三十二字。 上天虚无，玄洞九五，太上阿房，统灵威户，玉衡摄气，脑华玄睹，统御上部，通神达古。 度中部八景 大赤天主中部赤字玉诀 朱书玉字，三十二字。 赤明开真，三天气和，洞丹阳光，五藏不枯，丹天所宝，朱宫扶苏，纳炼流泉，朱元无徂。 度下部八景 禹余天主下部赤字玉诀 黄书玉字，三十二字。 黄中理气，元生自尊，胃管幽通，六府俱存，白元公子，桃康德淳，养育朱丹，洞神往还。 东方青帝八会内音自然玉字九炁总诸天文 亶娄阿会，无和观音，须延明首，法揽菩昙，稼那阿弈，忽诃流吟，华都曲丽，鲜菩育臻，答落大梵，散烟庆云，飞洒玉都，明魔上门，无行上首，回跖流玄，阿陁龙罗，四象吁员。 诀：东方内音毕，弟子回心，东向伏，冥目。 师叩齿九通，祝曰： 赤明开图，八炁回真，总统玄门，青帝大神，流化九外，缠绵我身，灵音八书，六十四篇，洞明天地，与我合仙，运致龙驾，上升帝轩。 毕，弟子仰头，九咽炁，次读细字，唱度之，横读之也。 南方赤帝八会内音自然玉字三炁总诸天文 南爓洞浮，玉眸诜诜，梵形落空，九灵推前，泽洛菩台，绿罗大千，眇莽九丑，韶谣缘邅，云上九都，飞生自骞，那育郁馥，摩罗法轮，霐持无镜，揽资运容，馥朗廓弈，神缨自宫。 诀：南方内音毕，弟子回心，南向伏，冥目。 师叩齿三通，祝曰： 三炁徘徊，灵凤来飞，玉音八字，焕烂紫微，日吉大庆，我道洞开，朱丹哺饲，仰吸灵辉，生生水火，绛被羽衣，登空玄步，足践凤梯，周旋八天，七祖相随。 毕，弟子仰头三咽炁，次度细字。 西方白帝八会内音自然玉字七炁总诸天文 刀利禅猷，婆泥咎通，宛薮涤色，大眇之堂，流罗梵萌，景蔚肃嵎，易邈无寂，宛首少都，阿滥郁竺，华莫筵由，九开自辩，阿那品首，无量扶盖，浮罗合神，玉诞长桑，栢空度仙。 诀：西方内音毕，弟子回心，西向伏，冥目。 师叩齿七通，祝曰： 七炁金灵，八天尊神，白虎策辈，师子捧辕，七炁缠绵，炼我成仙，身发金光，肺照素云，内外变化，升入洞门，七祖出夜，九幽放魂，三徒五苦，长斩恶根，同欢福舍，受庆自然，亿劫开度，随运长存。 毕，弟子仰头，七咽炁，次度细字。 北方黑帝八会内音自然玉字五炁总诸天文 玃无自育，九日道乾，坤母东覆，形摄上玄，陆罗育邈，眇炁合云，飞天大丑，总监上天，沙陁劫量，龙汉瑛鲜，碧落浮黎，空歌保珍，恶弈无品，洞妙自真，元梵恢漠，幽寂度人。 诀：北方内音毕，弟子回心，北向伏，冥目。 师叩齿五通，祝曰： 玄天徘徊，流景上清，大有启运，八字高明，飞玄澄虚，洞音自生，五炁缠绵，灌我身形，冠带北单，受炼洞灵，肾府化出，内外光精，飞行三界，遨宴紫庭，七祖同庆，欢乐劫龄，七宝林中，反胎更形，长夜灭死，南宫记名，黄箓白简，削死上生。 毕，弟子仰头，五咽炁，次度细字，次读太岁以下盟文。 次度策文 封八威策法，先读弟子名，次读师名。 上版符诀曰： 天灵步兵，太一升天，在地关白，生天命威，命主尸骨，星地命出，月天地度。 又诀曰： 焰明灵威仰，洞浮极炎赤熛弩，通班元成含枢杻，上金昌开曜魄宝，黑节灵会隐侯局。

Mysterious Cavern’s Nine and Five,
Supreme Apang,

Jade Balance harnesses qi,
Brain’s blossom gazes into the profound,
Ruling the Upper Register,
Communing with spirits and reaching antiquity."

**Eight Luminaries of the Middle Register**
The Great Crimson Heaven’s Lord of the Middle Register’s Red Character Jade Instructions.
**Vermilion Script in Jade Characters**
Thirty-two characters:
"Crimson clarity reveals the true,
Three Heavens’ qi in harmony,
Cavern’s cinnabar radiates yang light,
Five viscera never wither,
Treasured by the Cinnabar Heaven,
Vermilion Palace’s lush abundance,
Receiving and refining flowing springs,
Primordial vermilion knows no decay."

**Eight Luminaries of the Lower Register**
The Yu-Yu Heaven’s Lord of the Lower Register’s Red Character Jade Instructions.

Thirty-two characters:
"Yellow Center governs qi,
Primordial life arises in self-respect,
Stomach’s conduit darkly opens,
Six palaces all preserved,
White Prime Youth,
Peach’s virtue pure and sincere,
Nurturing and fostering cinnabar,
Cavern spirits come and go."

Wuhe Guanyin,

Eight qi return to the true,
Governor of the Mysterious Portal,
Great Azure Emperor Spirit,
Flowing transformations beyond the Nine,
Entwining my body,
Sacred sounds of eight scriptures,
Sixty-four chapters,
Illuminating Heaven and Earth,
Uniting with me in transcendence,
Conveying the dragon chariot,
Ascending to the Imperial Terrace."

Life’s water and fire,
Crimson-clad in feathered robes,

Feet treading the phoenix ladder,
Circulating through the Eight Heavens,
Seven ancestors follow in tow."

"Dāolì Chányóu,
Póní Jiùtōng,
Wǎnsǒu Dí sè,
Dàmiǎo Zhītáng,
Liúluó Fànméng,
Jǐngwèi Sùyú,
Yìmiǎo Wújì,

Body emits golden light,

Inner and outer transformations,

Three disciples and five sufferings,

Receiving blessings naturally,

Abiding with the turning of the Dao."

"Juéwú Zìyù,
Jiǔrì Dàoqián,
Kūnmǔ Dōngfù,

Lùluó Yùmiǎo,

chunks.original_text: 下版符诀曰： 太上太一版，真经黄帝书。 又诀曰： 慧灵开洪灾度人。 次思前从飞龙，后导天钧，凤啸鸾鸣，十二华光，建三七色节命灵之旛，给五帝玉童玉女各十二人。 五帝侍卫，三界司迎，弟子受策，长跪师前。 勅众符曰： 东流之水，徘徊五城，魄入魂出，澡炼身形，某甲奉受，灵宝众符，永得长生，急急如太上律令。 次封策两头祝曰： 元始太真，五灵高尊，太华皓映，洞朗八门，五老告命，无幽不闻，上御九天，中制酆山，下镇河海，十二水源，八威神咒，灵策玉文，召龙负水，收炁聚云，束魔送鬼，扫荡祆群，万精摧落，所诛无蠲，日月五星，北斗七元，诸天诸地，诸水诸山，玉真所部，溟泠大神，仙王游宴，五帝杖旛，天丁前驱，金虎后奔，玃天猛兽，罗备四门，所呼立到，所召立前，赤书焕落，风火无间，有所摄验，金龙驿传。 祝毕，叩齿九通，仰天三啸，引炁三咽止。 用元始五老印封策毕。 次封杖法，叩齿三十六通，冥目思五帝史，各一人，衣随方色，有五色之光，流焕杖上。 五帝玉女各一人，合共卫杖左右。 毕，先以杖横捧於师前，头向左，此师行之。 次师执青帝符，命弟子看。 诀曰：青帝姓区，名更生。 竟授与弟子，弟子得符，东向叩齿九通，思青炁从口中入注肝中，生九重青华，宝光彻映项后。 毕，还授符与师，师纳上第一孔中。 竟，师祝曰： 无上青精，九炁太灵，神光遐散，流映东青，华景郁勃，灌子身形，宫府安镇，宝魂自生，洞达八朗，飞升玉庭。 毕，弟子引炁九咽止。 次师执赤帝符，命弟子看，诀曰：赤帝姓祝，名昌中。 竟，授与弟子。 弟子得符，南向叩齿三通，思赤炁从口中入注心中，生三重丹华，宝光彻映胸中。 毕，还授符与师，师纳上第二孔前。 竟，师祝曰： 丹华流瑛，宝芝生光，神精彻幽，散灵八方，直符摄炁，啸命朱童，三精焕敷，注子绛宫，赤神安镇，五香溢充，洞映形外，表裹发光，身生水火，独步飞行。 毕，弟子引炁三咽止。 次师执黄帝符，命弟子看，诀曰：黄帝姓司，名精。 竟，授与弟子，弟子得符，向王上叩齿十二通，思黄炁从口中入注脾中，生十二重黄华，宝光洞映一身。 毕，还授符与师。 师纳上第三孔中。 竟，师祝曰： 总元高灵，回神四乡，黄上散华，五帝交芳，流精散漫，十二重光，混合子形，万神相迎，安备黄脾，养炁中房，保龄度劫，永镇无穷。 毕，弟子引炁十二咽止。 次师执白帝符，命弟子看诀曰：白帝姓辱，名曲正。 竟，授与弟子。 弟子得符，西向叩齿七通，思白炁从口中入注肺中，生七重素华，宝光洞映丹田。 毕，还授符与师，师纳上第四孔中。 竟，师祝曰： 金灵七炁，素华流纷，金精童子，道建元巾，带符摄炁， 万神会门，宝光弈弈，照子会根，安镇肺华，万劫长存。 毕，弟子引炁七咽止。 次师执黑帝符，命弟子看，诀曰：黑帝姓玄，名尹丰。 竟，授与弟子。 弟子得符，北向叩齿五通，思黑炁从口中入注肾中，生五重玄华，宝光洞映背外。 毕，还授符与师。 师纳上第五孔中。 竟，师祝曰： 北上大玄，五炁徘徊，宝华五重，流光焕辉，灵景郁秀， 洞映太微，仰注子身，肾府鲜开，安镇灵宅，万神总归， 身生羽翼，举形自飞。
chunks.translated_text:
**Lower Tablet Talisman Instructions:**
"Supreme Lord’s Supreme One tablet,
True scripture inscribed by the Yellow Emperor."

**Further Instructions:**
"Wisdom’s numinous power opens the flood’s deliverance of humanity."

Next, visualize: ahead, a flying dragon leads; behind, the Celestial Balance guides. Phoenixes shriek and simurghs cry, twelve resplendent lights arise. Erect the banner of three-seven colored nodes, the life-spirit’s standard, and assign twelve jade lads and lasses of the Five Thearchs to each. The Five Thearchs’ attendants, the Three Realms’ overseers welcome; the disciple receives the memorial, kneeling long before the master.

**Decree to the Host of Talismans:**
"East-flowing waters,
meander through the Five Cities.
The *po* enters, the *hun* departs,
refining the body’s form.
So-and-so receives and upholds
the numinous treasures’ host of talismans,
to attain everlasting life.
Swiftly, swiftly, in accordance with the Supreme Lord’s statutes and ordinances."

Next, seal both ends of the memorial and invoke:
"Primal Beginning, Supreme Perfected,
Five Numinous Ones of lofty honor,
Great Flower’s luminous radiance,
penetrating brightness of the Eight Gates,
Five Elders proclaim the mandate,
no hidden place unheard.
Above, they govern the Nine Heavens;
in the middle, they restrain Mount Feng;
below, they pacify rivers and seas,
the twelve water sources.
Eight Might divine incantations,
numinous memorial of jade script,
summon dragons to bear water,
gather *qi* and amass clouds,
bind demons and dispatch ghosts,
sweep away and scatter pernicious hordes.
Myriad spirits are shattered and felled,
none spared from execution.
Sun, moon, and Five Planets,
Northern Dipper’s Seven Origins,
all heavens, all earths,
all waters, all mountains,
jade perfected ones’ retinue,
Mingling Cold’s great deities,
immortal kings at their banquets,
Five Thearchs’ staff-banners,
celestial soldiers lead the vanguard,
golden tigers rush in pursuit,
heavenly ferocious beasts,
arrayed to guard the four gates.
Those called arrive at once;
those summoned stand forthwith.
Crimson script blazes and scatters,
wind and fire unceasing.
Whatever is seized or verified
is transmitted by golden dragon couriers."

Upon completing the invocation, strike the teeth nine times, raise the head and roar thrice to heaven, then draw in *qi* and swallow three times to conclude. Seal the memorial with the Primal Beginning Five Elders’ seal.

**Next, the Staff-Sealing Method:**
Strike the teeth thirty-six times, close the eyes, and visualize the Five Thearchs’ scribes, each clad in the color of their direction, their five-colored lights streaming and blazing upon the staff. Each Thearch’s jade maiden, one to each, together guards the staff on left and right.

Conclude by first holding the staff horizontally before the master, its head pointing left—this the master performs.

Next, the master grasps the Green Thearch’s talisman and commands the disciple to observe.
**Instructions:**
"The Green Thearch’s surname is Ou, given name Gengsheng."
Having recited this, he hands it to the disciple. The disciple, receiving the talisman, faces east, strikes the teeth nine times, and visualizes green *qi* entering from the mouth to infuse the liver, where nine layers of green blossoms bloom, their precious light penetrating and illuminating the nape. Conclude, then return the talisman to the master, who places it into the first aperture above.

Having done so, the master invokes:
"Peerless azure essence,
Nine *qi* of supreme numinosity,
divine light spreads afar,
streaming to illumine the Eastern Azure.
Flourishing splendor of blossoms,
irrigating your body’s form,
palace and precincts securely pacified,
precious *hun* naturally arises,
penetrating the Eight Brightnesses,
soaring to ascend the Jade Court."

Conclude; the disciple draws in *qi* and swallows nine times to finish.

Next, the master grasps the Red Thearch’s talisman and commands the disciple to observe.
**Instructions:**
"The Red Thearch’s surname is Zhu, given name Changzhong."
Having recited this, he hands it to the disciple. The disciple, receiving the talisman, faces south, strikes the teeth three times, and visualizes red *qi* entering from the mouth to infuse the heart, where three layers of cinnabar blossoms bloom, their precious light penetrating and illuminating the chest. Conclude, then return the talisman to the master, who places it into the second aperture above.

Having done so, the master invokes:
"Cinnabar blossoms stream with crystal,
precious mushrooms radiate light,
divine essence penetrates the hidden,
dispersing numinosity to the eight directions.
The straight talisman seizes *qi*,
roaring command to the Vermilion Lads.
Three essences resplendently unfold,
infusing your crimson palace.
The Red Spirit securely pacified,
five fragrances overflow and fill,
penetrating illumination beyond form,
inner and outer blazing with light.
Body generates water and fire,
walking alone in flight."

Conclude; the disciple draws in *qi* and swallows three times to finish.

Next, the master grasps the Yellow Thearch’s talisman and commands the disciple to observe.
**Instructions:**
"The Yellow Thearch’s surname is Si, given name Jing."
Having recited this, he hands it to the disciple. The disciple, receiving the talisman, faces the center, strikes the teeth twelve times, and visualizes yellow *qi* entering from the mouth to infuse the spleen, where twelve layers of yellow blossoms bloom, their precious light penetrating and illuminating the entire body. Conclude, then return the talisman to the master, who places it into the third aperture above.

Having done so, the master invokes:
"Governor of the Primal, lofty numen,
turning spirit to the four quarters.
Yellow blossoms scatter above,
Five Thearchs’ fragrances intermingle.
Essence streams and disperses,
twelve layers of light,
blending and merging with your form.
Myriad spirits come to welcome,
securely establishing the Yellow Spleen,
nurturing *qi* in the central chamber,
preserving longevity through kalpas,
eternally pacifying without end."

Conclude; the disciple draws in *qi* and swallows twelve times to finish.

Next, the master grasps the White Thearch’s talisman and commands the disciple to observe.
**Instructions:**
"The White Thearch’s surname is Ru, given name Quzheng."
Having recited this, he hands it to the disciple. The disciple, receiving the talisman, faces west, strikes the teeth seven times, and visualizes white *qi* entering from the mouth to infuse the lungs, where seven layers of white blossoms bloom, their precious light penetrating and illuminating the cinnabar field. Conclude, then return the talisman to the master, who places it into the fourth aperture above.

Having done so, the master invokes:
"Seven *qi* of golden numinosity,
white blossoms streaming in profusion.
Golden essence lads,
Dao established in the primal kerchief.
Bearing talismans to seize *qi*,
myriad spirits gather at the gate.
Precious light gleaming and glistening,
illuminating your meeting root.
Securely pacifying the lung’s blossom,
enduring through ten thousand kalpas."

Conclude; the disciple draws in *qi* and swallows seven times to finish.

Next, the master grasps the Black Thearch’s talisman and commands the disciple to observe.
**Instructions:**
"The Black Thearch’s surname is Xuan, given name Yin Feng."
Having recited this, he hands it to the disciple. The disciple, receiving the talisman, faces north, strikes the teeth five times, and visualizes black *qi* entering from the mouth to infuse the kidneys, where five layers of mysterious blossoms bloom, their precious light penetrating and illuminating the back’s exterior. Conclude, then return the talisman to the master, who places it into the fifth aperture above.

Having done so, the master invokes:
"Northern Supreme’s great mystery,
five *qi* meandering and lingering.
Five layers of precious blossoms,
streaming light blazing and radiant.
Numinous splendor lush and elegant,
penetrating illumination of the Grand Tenuity.
Raising to infuse your body,
the kidney’s precincts freshly open.
Securely pacifying the numinous abode,
myriad spirits wholly return.
Body sprouts feathered wings,
lifting form to fly of itself."

Great One ascends to Heaven,
On Earth, report to the White Pass,
Born in Heaven, life’s might commands,
Life’s master, corpse and bones,

chunks.original_text: 毕，弟子引炁五咽止。 次纳符竟，以朱蜡封杖两头空处，上用元始之章印之，下以五老之章印之。 毕，弟子叩齿三十六通，思五帝直符吏各一人，衣随方有五色之光，流焕杖上； 五帝玉女各一人，合共卫杖左右。 弟子依前横捧杖。 师祝之曰： 太阳之山，元始上精，开天张地，甘竹通灵，直符守吏， 部御神兵，五色流焕，朱火金铃，辅翼上真，出幽入冥， 招天天恭，摄地地迎，指鬼鬼死，祆魔束形，灵符神杖， 威制百精，兴摄群方，与我俱生，万劫之后，以代我形， 景为五解，神升上清，承符告命，靡不敬听。 毕，引五方炁二十五咽，止。 次师告丹水文 某岳先生大洞法师臣某甲，告弟子某甲等：元始天尊於眇莽之中，敷演真文，结成妙经。 劫劫济度，无有穷已，如尘沙巨亿无绝。 灵文隐奥，秘于金阁，众真宗奉，诸天所仰。 逮于赤鸟，降授仙公，灵宝妙经，於是出世度人。 吾谬禀微缘，运值灵文，先师显饰，奉传至法，誓为身宝，岂敢宣泄。 劫运推移，其法应行，有合真之人，依科听付。 今誓九天，启付某甲，受经之后，当依明科，肃己励躯，精诚勤苦，断绝世缘，唯志大乘，供养朝礼，讲习妙赜，参问有道，导引精研，修斋服御，希求飞腾，尊道敬师，推祟根本，不得唝嗃，有面无心，攻伐本根，自造无端。 轻慢经宝，皮好胎诞，淫欲贪着，嫉妒恚恨，胸心谄楚，怀毒在内，一旦犯违，身充三泉。 当以某甲三曾五祖，同沦地岳，万劫无原。 今建立黄坛，关盟五帝，付授宝文十部妙经，诸天五岳，咸对盟文，检行慎法，抱於中心，飞仙可期，终成道真，善自肃励，如四极明科律文。 次弟子自盟文 某府县乡里某岳先生洞玄弟子某甲，稽首再拜，上启元始天尊、太上道君、十方尊神、四方已得道至真。 太上灵宝三十六部尊经宝符，高玄大法师某，因缘宿福，九天之劫，轮转不灭，庆祚所逮，轮化所籍，得生法门。 先缘发愿，仰羡至阀，法板大乘，心神欣踊，自恐腐骸。 今遭天运推移，皇道数行，蒙法师某甲所见拔擢，开导愚蒙，赐臣灵文，奉对圣君。 肉尸惶惧，洗除浊秽，得侍灵坛，俯荷拔擢，荣过分表。 某当励己肃体，供养尊礼，弃情退累，志托幽阜，长乖世涂，唯志丘岩，昼夜朝拜，思竭愚管，庶凭圣文，拔度朽骸，至心悾慊，无有二念，不敢违盟负誓，欺师慢道，有面无心，不保劫数。 某自收罪考，吞声敢言，引某七世父母、九玄祖考，以为证誓，见世生人、九族种亲以为盟约。 某自乐仙道，时不敢拘迫，一日有违，生死同沦地岳五道，不敢蒙原。 上告元始，下誓五帝，身对师宝，自立盟誓。 丹情至心，唯蒙矜纳。 臣某诚惶诚恐，稽首再拜。 次师起立北向，左手执真文二录。 弟子长跪，以右手持信物，师叩齿三十六通，存五藏之色，令备具合成宝盖之云罗，覆经及师。 从而祝曰： 天书简不烦，道德自备足，修之必神仙，当复何所欲，文耀太无间，焕然而朗郁，传授悉依法，泄慢堕地狱。 次弟子跪，九拜，三起三伏，奉受真文，带策执杖，礼十方一拜。 从北方始，东回而周讫。 想见太上真形如天尊象矣。 毕，次师起巡行，咏步虚。 其辞日： 稽首礼太上，烧香归虚无。 流明随我回，法输亦三周。

Having completed this, the disciple draws *qi* and swallows it five times, then ceases. Next, after inserting the talisman, he seals both hollow ends of the staff with red wax, impressing the upper end with the seal of the Primordial Beginning and the lower with the seals of the Five Elders. Done, the disciple strikes his teeth thirty-six times, visualizing the five *Direct Talisman Officials of the Emperors*, each clad in robes matching their directional hue, their five-colored radiance streaming and blazing upon the staff; and the five *Jade Maidens of the Emperors*, one for each, together guarding the staff on left and right. The disciple then holds the staff horizontally as before. The master invokes:

"Mountain of the Great Yang,
Primordial Essence on high,
opening heaven and unfurling earth,
sweet bamboo channeling the numinous.
Direct Talisman Guardians,
marshaling divine soldiers,
five hues streaming and blazing,
crimson fire and golden bells,
assisting the perfected on high,
emerging from darkness and entering shadow.
Summoning the heavens, the heavens bow,
commanding the earth, the earth welcomes.
Pointing at ghosts, ghosts perish,
demons of heresy bound in form.
Numinous talisman, divine staff,
commanding all spirits with awe,
governing all directions,
living with me as one.
After ten thousand kalpas,
replacing my form,
its splendor the Five Liberations,
spirit ascending to the Upper Clarity.
Receiving the talisman and proclaiming the decree,
none dare disobey."

Done, he draws the *qi* of the five directions and swallows it twenty-five times, then ceases.

Next, the master proclaims the *Cinnabar Water Text*:

"Great Cavern Master of Such-and-Such Peak, your servant So-and-So, addresses his disciples So-and-So and others: The Primordial Heavenly Worthy, within the vast and boundless, unfolded and expounded the true scriptures, weaving them into wondrous sutras. Kalpa after kalpa, salvation knows no end, like grains of sand or countless billions without cease. The numinous scriptures, profound and recondite, were hidden within the Golden Pavilion, revered by the assembled perfected, looked up to by all heavens. In the era of the Red Bird, they were bestowed upon the Immortal Duke, and thus the *Numinous Treasure Wondrous Sutra* emerged to deliver humanity.

I, by humble karmic affinity, have encountered these numinous scriptures. My late master, in manifesting their splendor, transmitted this supreme Dharma, which I vow to treasure as my own body—how dare I divulge it recklessly? Yet as kalpas turn and destiny shifts, the Dharma’s time has come to spread. To those who align with the true, I transmit it according to the rites.

Today, I swear before the Nine Heavens to bestow these scriptures upon So-and-So. After receiving them, you must adhere to the luminous precepts: purify yourself, discipline your body, cultivate sincerity and diligence, sever worldly ties, and aspire solely to the Great Vehicle. Make offerings, perform rites, study the profound mysteries, seek guidance from the enlightened, practice *daoyin* and refine your essence. Observe fasts, regulate your attire, and yearn for transcendence. Honor the Dao and revere your master, upholding the root with devotion. Do not feign reverence with hollow words, nor attack the very foundation of your being with reckless deeds. Do not slight the sacred scriptures, nor indulge in superficial piety, lust, greed, jealousy, or hatred. Do not harbor deceit in your heart or conceal malice within. Should you violate these vows even once, your body will sink into the Three Springs.

You, So-and-So, along with your three progenitors and five ancestors, shall together descend into the earthly prisons, lost for ten thousand kalpas without reprieve. Today, I establish the Yellow Altar, ally with the Five Emperors, and transmit the *Ten Sections of Treasured Scriptures* and the wondrous sutras. All heavens and the Five Peaks bear witness to this covenant. Examine your conduct, guard the Dharma, and hold it within your heart. Ascension to immortality may then be expected, and you shall ultimately attain the true Dao. Strive with solemnity, as prescribed in the *Bright Statutes of the Four Poles*."

Next, the disciple proclaims his own covenant:

"Disciple So-and-So of Such-and-Such Prefecture, County, Village, and Peak, prostrates and bows twice, respectfully addressing the Primordial Heavenly Worthy, the Most High Lord of the Dao, the Venerable Deities of the Ten Directions, and the perfected who have attained the true Dao in all quarters.

The thirty-six sacred scriptures and talismans of the *Most High Numinous Treasure*, the supreme Dharma of the Great Master of the Lofty Mystery So-and-So, by karmic fortune and past blessings, have endured through the kalpas of the Nine Heavens, unceasing and undying. Blessed by destiny and transformed by the wheel of rebirth, I was born into the Dharma’s gate. From an early age, I vowed to admire the supreme lineage, the great vehicle of the Dharma’s board, my spirit leaping with joy, dreading only the decay of this mortal frame.

Now, as heavenly destiny shifts and the imperial Dao’s number unfolds, I have been graciously uplifted by Master So-and-So, who enlightened my ignorance and bestowed upon me the numinous scriptures, allowing me to stand before the sagely lord. My flesh trembles with awe; I have cleansed my filth and impurities to attend the numinous altar, humbly receiving this exalted favor, a glory beyond my due.

I vow to discipline myself, purify my body, make offerings and pay reverence, cast aside worldly burdens, and entrust my aspirations to the hidden peaks. Forever forsaking the paths of the world, I dedicate myself solely to the mountains and cliffs. Day and night, I shall prostrate in worship, striving to exhaust my humble devotion, hoping that through the sacred scriptures, my decaying frame may be delivered. With utmost sincerity and single-mindedness, I shall harbor no second thoughts. I dare not violate this covenant or betray my oath, nor deceive my master or slight the Dao, nor feign devotion with hollow words, nor fail to uphold the kalpas’ trust.

I, having gathered my transgressions and swallowed my shame, now dare to speak, invoking my seven generations of parents and ninefold ancestors as witnesses to this vow, and all living kin of my nine clans as guarantors of this covenant. I delight in the immortal’s path and shall never be constrained by time. Should I violate this even for a day, may my life and death alike sink into the earthly prisons and the Five Paths, without hope of reprieve.

Above, I appeal to the Primordial Beginning; below, I swear before the Five Emperors. Facing the master’s treasure, I establish this covenant. With cinnabar sincerity and utmost devotion, I humbly beg for your compassionate acceptance."

The disciple, prostrate, bows twice with reverence.

Next, the master rises and faces north, holding the two copies of the true scriptures in his left hand. The disciple kneels, holding the token of faith in his right hand. The master strikes his teeth thirty-six times, visualizing the colors of the five viscera, complete and perfectly forming a canopy of cloudlike brocade, covering the scriptures and himself. He then invokes:

"Celestial writ, unburdened and free,
the Dao and its power self-sufficient.
Cultivate it, and immortality is certain—
what more could one desire?
Its radiance shines in the Great Void,
brilliant and resplendent.
Transmit and receive all according to the Dharma;
leak or slight it, and fall into hell."

Next, the disciple kneels, performs nine bows, rising and prostrating three times, then receives the true scriptures. Girding his sash and grasping his staff, he bows once to each of the ten directions, beginning in the north and circling eastward to complete the circuit. He visualizes the Most High’s true form, resembling the Heavenly Worthy’s image.

Done, the master rises and paces in a circuit, chanting the *Step of the Void*:

"Prostrating, I bow to the Most High,
burning incense to return to the Void.
Luminous radiance follows me in turn,
the Dharma’s wheel likewise circles thrice."
chunks.overlap_context:
places it into the fifth aperture above.

Having done so, the master invokes:
"Northern Supreme’s great mystery,
five *qi* meandering and lingering.
Five layers of precious blossoms,
streaming light blazing and radiant.
Numinous splendor lush and elegant,
penetrating illumination of the Grand Tenuity.
Raising to infuse your body,
the kidney’s precincts freshly open.
Securely pacifying the numinous abode,
myriad spirits wholly return.
Body sprouts feathered wings,
lifting form to fly of itself."

chunks.original_text: 玄愿四大兴，灵庆及王侯。 七祖生天堂，煌煌曜景敷。 啸歌观大漠，天乐适我娱。 齐馨无上德，下仙不与俦。 妙想明玄觉，诜诜乘虚游。 旋行蹑云纲，乘虚步玄纪。 吟咏帝一尊，百关自调理。 俯命八海童，仰携高仙子。 诸天散香华，翛然灵风起。 宿愿定命根，故致高摽拟。 观乐太上前，万劫犹未始。 嵯峨玄都山，十方宗皇一。 岧岧天宝台，光明焰流日。 炼灿玉林华，蒨粲曜珠实。 常念餐元精，炼液固形质。 金光散紫微，窈窕大乘逸。 俯仰存太上，华景秀丹田。 左顾提郁仪，右盻携结璘。 六度冠梵行，道德随日新。 宿命积福应，闻经若至亲。 天挺超世才，乐诵希微篇。 冲虚太和炁，吐纳流霞津。 胎息静百关，寥寥究三便。 泥丸洞明景，遂成金华仙。 魔王敬受事，故能朝诸天。 皆从斋戒起，累功结宿缘。 飞行凌太虚，提携高上人。 控辔适十方，旋憩玄景阿。 仰观劫刃台，俯盻紫云罗。 逍遥太上京，相与坐莲华。 积学为真人，恬然荣卫和。 永享无期寿，万椿携奚足多。 大道师玄寂，升仙友无英。 公子度灵符，太一奉洞章。 舍利曜金姿，龙驾欻来迎。 天尊盻云舆，飘飘乘虚翔。 香花若飞雪，纷霭茂玄梁。 头脑礼金阙，携手邀玉京。 骞树圆景园，焕烂七宝林。 天兽三百名，师子巨万寻。 飞龙踯躅吟，神凤应节鸣。 灵风扇奇华，清香散人衿。 自无高仙才焉能耽此心。 严我九龙驾，乘虚以逍遥。 八天如指堂，六合何足辽。 众仙诵洞玄，太上唱清谣。 香花随风散，玉音成紫霄。 五苦一时迸，八难顺经寥。 妙哉灵宝囿，兴此大法桥。 天真帝一宫，蔼蔼冠耀灵。 流焕法轮纲，旋空入无形。 虚皇村云璈，众真诵洞经。 高仙凛手赞，弥劫保利贞。 至真无所待，时或辔飞龙。 长斋会玄都，鸣玉叩琼钟。 十华诸仙集，紫烟结成宫。 宝盖罗太上，真人把芙蓉。 散花陈我愿，握节征魔王。 法鼓会群仙，灵唱靡不同。 无可无不可，思与希微通。 次北向，诵礼经颂三首。 其辞曰： 乐法以为妻，爱经如珠玉。 持戒制六情，念道遣所欲。 淡泊正炁停，萧神静默。 天魔并敬护，世世受大福。 郁郁家国盛，济济经道兴。 天人其愿，缥缈入大乘。 因心立福田，靡靡法轮升。 七祖生天堂，我身白日腾。 大道洞玄虚，有念无不契。 炼质入仙真，遂成金刚体。 超度三界难，地狱五苦解。 悉归太上经，静念稽首礼。 每诵步虚一首讫，弟子唱善散花，礼一拜毕，唱三礼曰： 至心稽首礼太上无极大道。 至心稽首礼三十六部尊经。 至心稽首礼玄中大法师。 次平坐，弟子向师伏，师说元始禁戒，弟子句句唱诺，弟子某甲自称名，师告：弟子唱诺三言之。 《元始赤书五篇真文》，上清自然之书，九天始生之灵空洞之章，成天立地，开张万真，安神镇灵，生成兆民，匡御运度，保天长存。 上制天机，中检五灵，下策地祇，啸命河源，运役阴阳，召神使仙。 此至真之文，妙应自然，致天高澄，使地固安，五岳保镇，万品存焉。 元始刻题上帝灵都之馆，累经劫运，而其文保固天根，无有毁沦，与运推迁，混之不浊，秽之愈清，毁之不灭，灭之极明。 大有之文，天真所尊，自非勒名帝图，刻简来生者，斯文隐秘，莫得窥闻。 有得之子，与三炁长存，勤行其法，克致神仙。
chunks.translated_text:
The profound vow stirs the Four Great Ones,
blessings reach kings and lords.
Seven generations ascend to heaven’s halls,
brilliant and resplendent, their glory unfolds.
Whistling and singing, I gaze o’er the vast desert,
heavenly music delights my joy.
Equal in fragrance is the supreme virtue,
lesser immortals cannot compare.
Wondrous thoughts illumine the mysterious awakening,
in throngs they ride the void in flight.
Circling, they tread the cloud-net’s strands,
mounting the void to pace the dark principle’s path.
Chanting the hymn of the Imperial Unity,
a hundred meridians self-regulate.
Bending, I command the Eight Seas’ lads;
looking up, I grasp the lofty immortals’ hands.
The heavens scatter fragrant blossoms,
a subtle spirit-wind arises.
Long-held vows root destiny’s core,
thus attaining lofty eminence.
Beholding the music before the Most High,
ten thousand kalpas are but its beginning.
Towering is the Dark Capital’s mountain,
the ten directions revere the August One.
Lofty is the Heavenly Treasure Terrace,
its radiance flames like streaming sunlight.
Refining and glowing, the jade-forest’s flowers,
vibrant and resplendent, the pearl-fruits gleam.
Ever mindful to feast on primordial essence,
refining the fluids to firm the body’s form.
Golden light scatters the Purple Tenuity,
graceful and free, the Great Vehicle’s ease.
Looking up and down, I hold the Most High in mind,
radiant splendor adorns the cinnabar field.
Glancing left, I grasp the Somber Standard;
rightward, I take hold of the Knotted Brilliance.
Six Perfections crown the brahmic practice,
virtue and power renew with the sun.
Long-life’s accumulated blessings respond,
hearing the scriptures as if kin.
Heaven-endowed with talent surpassing the world,
joyfully reciting the subtle and rare texts.
Embracing the void and the Supreme Harmony’s qi,
exhaling and inhaling the rosy mist’s flow.
Fetal breathing stills a hundred meridians,
in emptiness, I fathom the Three Conveniences.
The Mud-Pill Palace gleams with bright light,
thus becoming a Golden Flower Immortal.
The Demon King reverently receives his charge,
hence I ascend to the heavens.
All begins with fasting and precepts,
accumulating merit to bind past-life bonds.
Soaring flight traverses the Great Void,
uplifting the loftiest ones.
Reining in to journey the ten directions,
circling to rest on the Dark Radiance’s slopes.
Looking up at the Kalpa-Blade Terrace,
gazing down at the Purple Cloud Net.
Carefree in the Most High’s capital,
together we sit upon lotus blossoms.
Through accumulated study, one becomes a Perfected Person,
tranquil, the constructive and protective qi harmonize.
Eternally enjoying boundless life,
ten thousand cedars—what need for more?
The Great Dao’s master is the Dark Silence,
ascending immortals befriend the Peerless Hero.
The Noble Scion bestows the numinous talisman,
the Great Unity presents the cavernous scriptures.
The śarīra gleams with golden splendor,
the dragon-chariot suddenly arrives to welcome.
The Heavenly Worthy gazes from the cloud-carriage,
floating, floating, riding the void in flight.
Fragrant blossoms like flying snow,
swirling mists embellish the dark beams.
Bowing my head, I worship the Golden Portal,
hand in hand, we invite the Jade Capital.
The Kien Tree’s Round Radiance Garden,
resplendent with the Seven Treasures’ grove.
Three hundred named heavenly beasts,
lions vast as ten thousand fathoms.
Flying dragons pace and chant,
divine phoenixes sing in rhythm.
The spirit-wind fans wondrous blossoms,
pure fragrance scatters upon my lapels.
Without the talent of a lofty immortal,
how could one indulge such a heart?
I adorn my nine-dragon chariot,
riding the void in carefree ease.
The Eight Heavens like a hall at fingertip’s reach,
the Six Directions—how could they be distant?
The assembled immortals chant the Cavernous Mystery,
the Most High sings the pure hymn.
Fragrant blossoms scatter with the wind,
jade tones form in the purple clouds.
The Five Sufferings burst forth at once,
the Eight Difficulties follow the scriptures’ emptiness.
Wondrous is the Numinous Treasure’s preserve,
raising this great Dharma bridge.
The Heavenly Perfected’s Palace of Imperial Unity,
lush and luxuriant, crowns the radiant spirits.
Flowing and glowing, the Dharma-wheel’s net,
circling the void to enter the formless.
The Void Sovereign strikes the cloud-zither,
the assembled Perfected chant the Cavernous Scriptures.
Lofty immortals, solemn, join hands in praise,
through endless kalpas, they preserve integrity.
The Utmost Perfected awaits nothing,
at times reining in flying dragons.
Long fasts convene in the Dark Capital,
chiming jade strikes the jasper bells.
The Ten Flowers’ immortals gather,
purple mist congeals into a palace.
Jewel canopies array the Most High,
Perfected Persons hold the lotus.
Scattering blossoms, I declare my vow,
grasping the tally, I subdue the Demon King.
The Dharma drum summons the assembled immortals,
their numinous chants differ not in sound.
There is no can, there is no cannot—
thoughts commune with the subtle and rare.

Then, facing north, he recites three hymns of reverence and praise. Their words are:

Delighting in the Dharma as one’s wife,
cherishing the scriptures like pearls and jade.
Upholding precepts to restrain the six passions,
mindful of the Dao, I dispel desires.
Serene and pure, the upright qi abides,
the numinous spirit stills in silence.
Heavenly demons all revere and protect,
lifetimes receive great blessings.
Lush and flourishing, the household and kingdom prosper,
solemn and majestic, the scriptures and Dao thrive.
May the wishes of heaven and humankind be fulfilled,
floating and distant, entering the Great Vehicle.
Establishing the field of blessings through the heart,
the Dharma wheel ascends in boundless ascent.
Seven generations ascend to heaven’s halls,
my body ascends in broad daylight.
The Great Dao pervades the Cavernous Void,
with thought, nothing fails to accord.
Refining the form to enter immortal truth,
thus becoming a Vajra body.
Surpassing the Three Realms’ difficulties,
the Five Sufferings of hell are dissolved.
All return to the Most High’s scriptures,
in stillness, I bow my head in reverence.

After each recitation of the *Step of the Void*,
the disciple chants "Excellent!" and scatters blossoms,
completing one bow, then chants the Three Reverences:

With utmost sincerity, I bow to the Most High, the Boundless Great Dao.
With utmost sincerity, I bow to the Thirty-Six Divisions of Venerable Scriptures.
With utmost sincerity, I bow to the Great Dharma Master of the Dark Mystery.

Then, sitting upright, the disciple prostrates before the master.
The master recites the *Yuan Shi* prohibitions and precepts,
the disciple responding "Yes" to each phrase.
The disciple, so-and-so, states his name,
the master instructs: the disciple chants "Yes" three times.

The *Primordial Beginning’s Red Writ of Five Chapters*,
the Upper Clarity’s natural scripture,
the Nine Heavens’ primal-born numinous Cavernous Chapters,
forming heaven and establishing earth,
unfolding the myriad Perfected,
pacifying spirits and anchoring numina,
giving life to and nurturing the multitudes,
governing and guiding the cosmic movements,
preserving heaven’s eternal endurance.
Above, it regulates the celestial mechanisms;
in the middle, it inspects the Five Numinous;
below, it governs the earthly deities,
whistling commands to the River’s source,
directing and employing yin and yang,
summoning spirits and dispatching immortals.
This is the scripture of the Utmost Perfected,
wondrously responding to the natural,
causing heaven’s heights to clear,
making earth firm and secure,
preserving and guarding the Five Peaks,
wherein the ten thousand beings abide.
The Primordial Beginning inscribed it in the Divine Capital’s hall,
through countless kalpas and cosmic movements,
its text remains steadfast at heaven’s root,
never destroyed or lost,
moving with the cosmic shifts,
mingling yet unstained,
defiled yet ever purer,
destroyed yet not extinguished,
extinguished yet supremely luminous.
The Great Possession’s scripture,
revered by the Heavenly Perfected,
unless one’s name is inscribed in the Imperial Register,
carved on the bamboo slips of future lives,
this scripture remains hidden and secret,
none may glimpse or hear of it.
Those who obtain it
abide with the Three Qi eternally;
diligently practicing its methods,
they attain the divine immortals’ rank.

Done, the master rises and paces in a circuit, chanting the *Step of the Void*:

chunks.original_text: 但精心躬奉，家国安宁，保命度灾，扫诸不祥。 天子侯王奉之，致国太平，凶寇自夷，边域不争，兆民歌唱，普天兴隆。 运推数周，正道当行，有得之者，庶招自然，天真妙重，九天所秘，不得轻泄，考罚尔身。 若弟子应传经者，年限虽未盈五八，皆令法信充备，依黄箓为三师，开度弟子一十九人，功德满足，然后得传宝诀，不得非师，私相教授。 若违科妄泄，无盟而传，师受四极之考，七祖同沦地岳，万劫不原。 可不慎之，可不慎之，尔其信焉。 毕，弟子起礼三拜，还伏。 次授六誓文曰： 一誓不轻泄，二誓不猥慢，三誓不妄传，四誓不口说，五誓不触经禁，六誓不受财卖道。 天尊六誓以质人心，人心既固，道心亦真，不得违誓越盟，永受风刀。 说誓之时，先捻香，弟子一手指天，男左女右。 毕，弟子礼六拜，师立，诵曰： 真道高妙，应感则宣，丹心恳至，有恻上玄，紫文炼质，神金制魔，豁落威灵，佩之神仙，今启传付，誓勿妄言，宝秘真降，泄必祸臻，天科严峻，尔其奉焉。 毕，弟子又礼六拜。 次师简授弟子法位曰：太上灵宝无上洞玄弟子某岳先生某甲。 弟子长跪受毕，退合简端身，称之礼本师，九拜，三起三伏，肘行膝步。 讫，左行东面，向西礼，再礼； 次北，次东，次南，各再礼，日朝四极。 还复位，礼监度三师，各三拜。 次还读前谒十方版及五师版，依前面方所，唯五师向西。 毕，长跪大谢，弟子叩头，搏颊无数。 其辞曰：
chunks.translated_text:
Only through wholehearted devotion and personal reverence may household and state know peace, life be preserved, calamities averted, and all inauspicious omens swept away. When the Son of Heaven and feudal lords uphold it, the realm attains great tranquility, hostile invaders submit of themselves, borderlands cease their strife, the myriad people sing in praise, and all under heaven flourishes. As the cycles of fate revolve, the true Dao prevails; those who obtain it summon forth spontaneity, their celestial perfection held in wondrous esteem, concealed by the Nine Heavens. It must not be lightly disclosed, lest judgment befall your person.

Should a disciple be deemed worthy of transmission, though the prescribed years of fifty-eight have not yet been fulfilled, let all ritual requisites be fully prepared. Following the Yellow Register, take the Three Masters, and initiate nineteen disciples. Only when merit is complete may the precious instructions be conveyed. No unauthorized master may privately instruct others. Should one violate these statutes, recklessly divulging without covenant, both master and recipient shall face the Four Extremities’ trial, while seven generations of ancestors sink into the earthly mounds, bound for ten thousand kalpas without reprieve. Can one not be cautious? Can one not be cautious? Let this be heeded.

Thereupon, the disciple rises and bows thrice, then prostrates again.

Next, the Six Vows are conferred, saying:
First vow: not to lightly disclose.
Second vow: not to treat with irreverence.
Third vow: not to transmit recklessly.
Fourth vow: not to speak of it idly.
Fifth vow: not to transgress the scripture’s prohibitions.
Sixth vow: not to accept wealth in exchange for the Dao.

The Heavenly Worthy’s Six Vows bind the human heart; when the human heart is steadfast, the heart of the Dao is true. One must not violate these vows or breach the covenant, lest the Wind Blade befall them eternally.

As the vows are recited, first hold incense, and the disciple points one hand to heaven—left for men, right for women.

Thereupon, the disciple bows six times. The master stands and intones:
The true Dao is lofty and wondrous, revealed when resonance is felt. With sincere devotion, the Supreme Mystery is moved to compassion. The Purple Text refines the essence, divine gold subdues demons. Radiant and majestic, its power renders one a divine immortal. Now it is transmitted and entrusted—swear not to speak of it recklessly. Treasure and conceal the true descent; to divulge it is to invite disaster. The celestial statutes are stern—let this be upheld.

Thereupon, the disciple bows six times again.

Next, the master formally confers the disciple’s rank, saying: *Supreme Numinous Treasure, Peerless Cavern-Mystery Disciple, Master of Such-and-Such Peak, So-and-So.*

The disciple kneels to receive, then retreats, joining the tablets at the ends. Bowing to the original master, they perform nine prostrations, rising and kneeling thrice, advancing on elbows and knees.

Completed, they turn left, face east toward the west, and bow twice. Then they turn north, then east, then south, bowing twice to each, in the daily audience of the Four Extremities.

Returning to their position, they bow thrice to the Three Masters overseeing the transmission.

Next, they again read the petitions to the Ten Directions and the tablets of the Five Masters, facing the respective directions as before, save that the Five Masters face west.

Concluding, they kneel in profound gratitude. The disciple kowtows, striking their cheeks without count.

Their words are:

chunks.original_text: 太上灵宝无上洞玄弟子，某岳先生臣某等，今故烧香叩头，归身归神归命十方无极太上灵宝天尊，十乡诸灵官已得道至真诸君，丈人，三十六部尊经玄中大法师，太上玄一三真人，太极高玄法师，三天大法师正一真人，及三界表里一切神灵。 臣等以今传授弟子某甲，登坛告盟，希仰太上众尊济度之恩，原赦臣某师从弟子等，自从缘起有身父母，依因一切眷属，及得某等千罪万过，并令传授。 置斋以来，逮乎兹日，违科犯法，进止失仪，呼名乖性，尊卑越次，付度差违，特乞大慈开宥，不见罪罚。 伏愿恩流即时，威播今日，且今日宝珠之口，有无鞅众登宝珠之上，获参胜侣，乃超虎涧而同至，越龙山而俱到，证因四果。 果於向者克成五愿，愿偶今时。 所谓珠口不知盈满，水火无以烧沉，故今辰男女仰慕凤轮，远期龙驾。 凡此智友，既各父元父之父，同一玄一之一，愿五眼报勤，三明赏德，功骋喜泰二勤畅休欢，恩寝死符，福播生录。 永始元始之歌谣，长卒不卒之庆扑。 各使餐能命算，食辨形体，佑盖尊卑，卫活长少，天保信向之男，法护至到之女。 女果紫简，男谐玉牒，不朽与赤甫争能，得道共山图而竞解，祸路承此同灭，福阶因慈各兴。 帝主延昌，爱民治国，三归共往，四教俱来。 狱厄长免，因缘永绝，灾恼不起，衰患勿生。 其诸此外，随愿各刻，求官得官，求贵得贵，求道得道，求真得真。 所愿悉谐，所欲咸遂，道成天地，功济生灵，遍为诸天日月星宿、山川岳渎、龙王鸟王、兽王虫王、万物神王、一切天王，在在处处天神地神、山水灵祇、里域官长、凡诸营卫一切吏兵，并愿即时旋转，俱登妙胜。 即愿七元安度，四象无愆，天见喜祥，地表灵瑞，山开宝牒，河出龙图，五芝绿草，遍布郊野，四方清净，天下太平。 无边功德，逮及监临官对，执劳随喜，并观听男女，一蒙有缘，同享上福，冥资六道，庆被四生，五苦三恶，含灵有识，咸蒙荡沐，冠带天衣，适乐自在，长结善缘，永为法侣，从此不退，得道为期。 至於坛主盟身某，五文入体，玉符养质，神真卫命，天书感瑞，八会应图，六度常持，四行无缺，五通仙举，十转飞腾，金刚浄体，克隆圣果，稽首十方，常住三宝。 次师诵三徒五苦辞曰： 三才及万物，倚伏各有龄。 终始待劫数，福尽天地倾。 往反於五道，苦哉更死生。 辗转三徒中，去来与祸并。 大贤慎兹诫，忍性念割情。 愚夫不信法，罪痛常自婴。 吾念世无已，今故重告明。 若欲度斯患，归命太上经。 罪福不由他，谅自发尔声。 大贤故闭口，欲绝诸恶缘。 灭念归兼至，倚伏待长泯。 弘道以安世，终当见正真。 淫嫉为祸首，灭身之至患。 含养如此害，岂是道所安。 知恶而不革，恐必致夭残。 怀毒日斋直，令我发长叹。 宿命有信然，弱丧谓之无。 皆欲眼前见，过目即言悠。 大贤明道教，惨戚愍顽夫。 依依念子苦，勤勤令我忧。 人命以消尽，亦犹膏中火。 四大暂相寓，五物权时假。 盛年当勤学，趣求存吾我。 福尽身神散，冥冥地狱下。 上圣畏是故，寻道度斯祸。 学仙行为急，奉戒制情心。 虚夷正气居，仙圣自相寻。 若不信法言，胡为栖山林。 大贤乐经戒，受之为身宝。 就学常苦晚，治身恨不早。
chunks.translated_text:
The Supreme Perfected, Most High Numinous Treasure, Peerless Cavernous Mystery Disciples, the so-and-so Peak Masters, your subjects so-and-so and others, now reverently burn incense and kowtow, entrusting body and spirit, pledging life to the Ten Directions’ Boundless Most High Numinous Treasure Heavenly Worthies, the Perfected Lords of the Ten Realms who have attained the Dao, the Venerable Ones, the Thirty-Six Divisions of Revered Scriptures, the Great Dharma Masters of the Cavernous Mystery, the Three Perfected of the Supreme Unity, the High Mystery Dharma Masters of the Great Ultimate, the Orthodox Unity Perfected of the Three Heavens’ Great Dharma Masters, and all the deities within and beyond the Three Realms.

Your subjects, in transmitting the precepts to disciple so-and-so, who ascends the altar to swear the covenant, humbly beseech the grace of the Most High and all the Worthies to deliver and save us. We pray for the forgiveness of your subjects, this master and disciples, from the time our parents gave us form, along with all our karmic dependents, and for the myriad sins and transgressions of so-and-so, that all may be permitted this transmission.

From the establishment of the retreat until this day, we have violated precepts and laws, erred in conduct and decorum, mispronounced names contrary to nature, transgressed the order of seniority, and deviated in the conferral of ranks. We implore your great compassion to absolve and pardon us, that we may not incur punishment.

We humbly pray that your grace flow forth at this very moment, your majesty manifest today. May the mouths of the precious pearl today, though countless in number, ascend upon the precious pearl, attain fellowship with the exalted, together cross the Tiger Gorge and arrive as one, together traverse Dragon Mountain and reach its summit, and realize the four fruits of attainment. May the fruits of past vows be fulfilled in fivefold, their fulfillment coinciding with this very hour.

As the pearl’s mouth knows no overflow, as water and fire cannot burn or sink it, so today do men and women gaze in admiration at the phoenix wheel, awaiting afar the dragon chariot. All these wise companions, each the father of their father’s father, united in the One of the Mysterious Unity, we pray that the five eyes reward diligence, the three luminances bestow virtue, that merit and joy, toil and ease, all flow in harmonious delight. May the tally of death be dissolved, the record of life blessed. May the hymns of the Primordial Beginning endure forever, the unending celebration of the never-ending resound.

May each be granted extended lifespan and discerning form, protected and sheltered in their station, whether high or low, young or old. May the faithful sons of heaven’s protection and the guarded daughters of the Dharma attain their ends. May the women’s fruits be inscribed on purple tablets, the men’s names harmonize with the jade registers. May they vie in immortality with the Red Earl, attain the Dao and compete in liberation with the Mountain Charts. May the paths of misfortune be extinguished together, the steps of fortune arise through compassion.

May the Emperor’s reign be prolonged, the people cherished, the state governed. May the Three Refuges be universally embraced, the Four Teachings universally come. May imprisonment and distress be forever averted, karmic bonds eternally severed. May calamities and afflictions not arise, decline and suffering not be born.

For all other wishes, may each be carved as desired: those who seek office attain office, those who seek nobility attain nobility, those who seek the Dao attain the Dao, those who seek the Perfected attain the Perfected. May all aspirations be fulfilled, all desires realized. May the Dao be perfected in heaven and earth, merit deliver living beings. May it extend to all the celestial bodies of the heavens—sun, moon, and stars—the mountains and rivers, the dragon kings, bird kings, beast kings, insect kings, spirit kings of the myriad things, and all heavenly kings. In every place, whether heavenly spirits or earthly deities, mountain and water numina, local officials and guardians, all the soldiers and functionaries of the various defenses, may they all turn at once and together ascend to wondrous victory.

We pray that the Seven Origins be peacefully traversed, the Four Symbols free of transgression. May heaven display auspicious omens, earth reveal numinous portents. May mountains open their treasure tablets, rivers bring forth dragon charts. May the five magic mushrooms and green grasses spread across the countryside. May the four directions be purified, the world know great peace.

May boundless merit extend to the overseeing officials, those who labor and rejoice in the work, and all men and women who observe and listen. May all those of karmic affinity together enjoy supreme blessings, their dark resources reaching the six paths, their blessings extending to the four kinds of birth. May the five sufferings and three evils, all sentient beings with consciousness, be cleansed and bathed, crowned with heavenly robes, attaining joy and ease, forever forming good affinities, eternally companions of the Dharma, never again retreating, with the attainment of the Dao as their appointed time.

As for the altar master who pledges himself, so-and-so: may the five scriptures enter his body, the jade talismans nurture his essence, divine perfected guard his life, heavenly writings inspire auspicious signs. May the eight assemblies correspond to the charts, the six perfections be constantly upheld, the four practices remain unbroken, the five penetrations elevate him to immortality, the ten transformations enable him to soar. May his body be as adamantine and pure, perfectly attaining the sagely fruit. We bow our heads to the Ten Directions, ever abiding in the Three Treasures.

Next, the master recites the verses on the three destinies and five sufferings:

The Three Powers and the myriad things,
Each dependent, each with its span.
End and beginning await the kalpas’ reckoning,
When fortune is exhausted, heaven and earth collapse.

Back and forth through the five paths,
Ah, the suffering of repeated death and birth!
Turning in the three destinies,
Coming and going with calamity.

Great worthies, heed this warning,
Restrain your nature, sever your passions.
Foolish men do not believe the Dharma,
Their sins and pains ever cling to them.

I grieve that the world knows no end,
Thus I now proclaim it anew.
If you wish to cross this suffering,
Take refuge in the Most High Scriptures.

Sin and fortune do not come from another,
Truly, they arise from your own voice.
Great worthies, therefore, seal your mouths,
Seeking to sever all evil affinities.

Extinguish thoughts, attain complete cessation,
Dependent arising awaits final dissolution.
Expound the Dao to pacify the world,
In the end, you shall see the True Perfected.

Lust and jealousy are the roots of misfortune,
The greatest perils to body and life.
Nurturing such harms,
How can the Dao find peace?

Knowing evil yet not reforming,
I fear it must lead to early death.
Harboring poison while fasting,
It makes me sigh deeply.

Karma from past lives is indeed so,
Yet the weak and lost call it nonexistent.
All wish to see it before their eyes,
Dismissing what passes beyond their gaze.

Great worthies, illuminate the Dharma’s teachings,
Mourn the stubborn and dull.
Tenderly I grieve for your suffering,
Diligently I cause myself sorrow.

Life is consumed and exhausted,
Like a flame in the oil.
The Four Great are but temporary lodging,
The Five Aggregates a provisional loan.

In your prime, study diligently,
Hasten to preserve your self.
When fortune is spent, body and spirit scatter,
In the dark hells below.

The sagely fear this,
Thus they seek the Dao to cross this calamity.
To learn immortality is urgent,
Uphold the precepts, restrain the heart.

Let emptiness and equanimity house the true qi,
The immortals and sages will naturally seek you.
If you do not believe the Dharma’s words,
Why dwell in the mountains?

Great worthies, delight in the scriptures and precepts,
Receive them as treasures for your body.
To begin study is ever too late,
To cultivate the self, one ever regrets not starting sooner.

chunks.original_text: 比当披幽赜，倏欻年已老。 执卷吸尔极，将更死痛恼。 吾故及弱龄，弃世以学道。 次法师还向东，口启言功，复官。 泰玄都正一平炁系天师阳平治左平炁臣某，稽首再礼，上言：谨按文书，臣素胎生肉人，禀命有幸得，生法门，被蒙大圣曲逮隆重，得叨妙法内外真要，长生度世不死之道，仰参上清三洞宝经升霞之卫，恩润重杳，莫之与比。 道重人轻，非臣臭骨所可当荷，辜负天官，若无首领。 臣以今即日，登此山岭，授度宝经与弟子某甲，出身中三部八景神仙骑乘，飞天神仙功曹，传言奏事小吏，关启五帝、五岳土地灵山里域真官注炁，监察授度，并见营卫。 皆是众官佑护之功，不胜受恩，谨为一切众官拜言功口章上闻。 愿上官典者，乞垂矜省，原赦臣前后所犯万没之罪，赐臣身得度千灾万厄之中，请为侍经玉童玉女，内外监察考召君吏、四野九野四面真官、土地灵山五帝、五岳上真，臣身三部八景飞天神仙功曹，天官骑乘，十方营卫众官，并及前后行来诸所经历，传授宣化，心口求愿，佑助之功，一切谒还天曹，加官进爵，言功举迁。 上功三千等，中功二千等，下功一千等。 书佐小吏，吏兵士卒各五百等，还入中宫。 上官典者，以时给与，悉令均平，无使遗脱恚恨者。 受功事讫，各还所职，营护臣身，禳却千灾毒，公私口舌，恶人谋议，一切伏匿绝灭太阴之中。 受恩无地，以为效信。 恩惟太上分别求哀臣愚，谨因内外众官真使、正一功曹、左右官使者、阴阳神决吏、科车赤符吏、刚风骑置驿马上章吏、飞龙骑吏官，各十二人出，奉操臣拜上言功口章一通，上诣三天曹，伏须告报。 臣某诚惶诚恐，稽首再礼以闻。 臣姓属某府某悬某观。 太清衔位 太岁

In a flash, the years have aged me.
Clutching the scroll, I reach the limit of my breath,
Soon to face death’s agony and sorrow.

Thus in my youthful prime,
I abandoned the world to study the Dao.
Next, the Dharma Master turned eastward,
His mouth declaring merit, then resuming office.

Tai Xuan Du Zhengyi, the Celestial Master of Yangping’s Left Rectifying Qi, Minister So-and-so,
Bows twice and respectfully submits:
According to the documents, I, a mere mortal of flesh and blood,
Fortunate in destiny, was born into the Dharma gate.
By the great sagely grace, I was graciously and profoundly favored,
Permitted to partake of the wondrous essentials of the inner and outer true teachings—
The Dao of immortality, transcendence, and deathlessness.
I humbly ascend the *Shangqing* and *Sandong* treasured scriptures’ ascending-aurora guard,
Whose boundless, profound favor is unmatched.

The Dao is weighty, man is light—
How could my foul bones bear such a burden?
To fail the celestial offices would leave me headless.

To confer the precious scriptures of initiation upon my disciple So-and-so,
Summoning from within his body the Three Divisions and Eight Radiant Spirits,

chunks.original_text: 臣告盟事讫，所请天灵地神，谒还九天，随宜进叙，臣身中玉虚真炁功曹使者、神仙乘骑，各按常次，从紫府玉阁妙门金户而入，周身匝体，缠绕百脉骨节，内填仙炁，外截邪源，炼魂保精，早得飞行。 神仙羽骑径升帝宸。 咽二十四炁止。 次法师复炉，祝曰： 香官使者、左右龙虎君、侍香诸灵官，当令此间传授之所，自然生金液丹碧芝英，百灵众真，交会在此香火案前，令臣得道，克获上仙。 弟子某甲等受福，内外家口蒙恩，十方仙童玉女，侍卫香烟，传奏臣向来言请，径至玉皇上帝几前。 次诵奉戒颂 道为无心宗，一切作福田。 一止功无定准，本愿各由人。 虚己应众生，注心莫不均。 大圣崇正教，亦由雨降天。 高凌靡不周，常卑故成渊。 海为百川王，是能舍龙鳞。 万劫保智用，岂但在厥年。 奉戒不暂亏，世世善结缘。 精思念大乘，会当体道真。 还戒颂 天尊大慈悲，说戒度众生。 威德被幽显，果报感真灵。 诸天来稽首，群魔自束形。 过去超八难，见在保千龄。 斋福行当息，相共送虔诚。 流梵逸云唱，飞香杂烟馨。 琼凤乘丹辇，金龙驾绿軿。 生死皆快乐，家国悉安宁。 毕，师弟子绕坛梵咏还。 事了。 亦可复炉前，於皇坛上行腾天藉地竟，师弟乃梵咏，出西北九天门，勿回顾也。 藉地解形符，青书白素上，腾天遁变符，黄书碧缯上。 亦有师云，未言功前，行之毕，次引弟子北向朝太上玉宸四拜，次东向谒大帝君再拜，次南向礼高上真人再拜，次西向拜天师张君再拜，次三日弟子言功，设斋谢恩，仪在别卷。 次弟子於坛本命之方投简法，次东向叩齿三通，上香祝曰： 无上三天玄元始三炁太上老君，召出我身中三五功曹、左右官使者、左右捧香驿龙骑吏、侍香玉童、侍香玉女、五帝直符、直日香官，各三十六人出。 关启此间土地、四面真官正神，我今正尔烧香关启，愿得太上十方正真之炁入我身中，令所启上闻，径御无上至真大圣尊神玉帝几前。 毕，回向王叩齿十二通，读简竟，祝曰： 天开地张，九炁分灵，三元同符，十方玄清，五老上帝，开真领生，丹书赤文，元始上精，普告无上，九土皇灵，今日上吉，万仙定生，我愿我仙，请投玉名，土府太皇，勒除罪形，奏简上宫，列簿华青，早得飞升，天地同灵，九祖种亲，腐骸更荣，魂升南宫，受化仙庭，今日告命，万神咸听，请以金钮，表明至情，请如所告，金龙驿程。 毕，上香复炉，如上法。 元始灵宝告九地土皇，灭罪言名求仙上法。 灵宝赤帝先生女云道士，某甲年若干岁，某月生，命系九天南斗领籍。 解曰：此文云赤帝者，是本命丙午，命系九天者，是正月二月生，南斗领籍，犹取本命之方，余效此。 愿神愿仙，长生度世，飞行上清，中皇九土，戊己黄神，土府五帝，乞削罪录，勒上太玄，请诣中宫，投简记名，金钮自信，金龙驿传。 太岁某子某月某子朔某日某子，於某府州县乡里中告文。 右朱书银简，青纸裹之，青丝缠钮九只，金龙一枚，埋所住中宫。 次谒版，剌版并埋坛之当方。 亦可投山洞渊泉中，勿令人得之。 凡简长一尺二寸，阔二寸四分，厚三分。 登坛法信如左： 金钱二万四千，听以铜钱宝物准当。 上金九两。 五色缯纹各一疋。
chunks.translated_text:
Having concluded the covenant rites, the celestial and terrestrial spirits invoked are now respectfully dismissed to return to the Nine Heavens, proceeding in due order. From the Purple Mansion’s Jade Pavilion, through the wondrous gate and golden portal, the Jade Void True Qi’s Merit Officers and the divine steeds of the immortals enter my body, encircling and suffusing every vessel, bone, and joint. Within, they fill me with immortal qi; without, they sever all sources of evil, refining the soul and preserving essence, that I may soon attain flight and ascension. The feathered steeds of the immortals ascend directly to the Imperial Throne. Swallow the Twenty-Four Qi and halt.

Next, the Dharma Master returns to the incense burner and intones:
"Incense Officers, Left and Right Dragon-Tiger Lords, and all attendant spirit officials—may this place of transmission naturally generate golden liquid, cinnabar, and azure mushrooms. May the hundred spirits and host of perfected ones gather here before this incense altar, that I may attain the Dao and swiftly achieve transcendence. May disciples So-and-so and all within their households, both inner and outer, receive blessings. May the ten directions’ immortal youths and jade maidens attend the fragrant smoke, conveying my supplications directly to the Jade Emperor’s celestial throne."

Next, recite the *Precepts Hymn*:
The Dao is the heartless origin,
All acts are fields of merit.
One cessation—no fixed measure of merit,
Each vow springs from the self.
Empty the self to respond to all beings,
Focus the mind without partiality.
The Great Sage exalts the true teaching,
As rain descends from heaven.
Lofty and boundless, none untouched,
Yet humility forms the abyss.
The sea is king of a hundred rivers,
For it can forsake even the dragon’s scales.
Through ten thousand kalpas, wisdom endures—
Not merely for this lifetime.
Uphold the precepts without lapse,
And life after life, good karma binds.
With concentrated thought, contemplate the Great Vehicle,
And you shall embody the Dao’s truth.

Recite the *Returning Precepts Hymn*:
The Heavenly Worthy, in great compassion,
Expounds the precepts to deliver all beings.
Virtue and power pervade the hidden and manifest,
Karmic retribution summons the true spirits.
The devas bow in reverence,
While demonic hordes restrain their forms.
The past transcends the Eight Difficulties,
The present secures a thousand years.
When the merit of the fast is complete,
Together we send forth our devotion.
The flowing Sanskrit and soaring clouds chant,
Fragrant smoke mingles with incense’s perfume.
Jade phoenixes ride crimson chariots,
Golden dragons draw emerald carriages.
In life and death, all find joy,
Families and nations attain peace.

Upon completion, master and disciples circumambulate the altar, chanting Sanskrit hymns, and conclude the rites. Alternatively, they may return to the incense burner and perform the *Ascending Heaven and Treading Earth* rites upon the august altar. Then, master and disciples chant Sanskrit hymns as they exit through the northwest gate of the Nine Heavens—without looking back.

The *Treading Earth* and *Dissolving Form* talismans are inscribed in blue on white silk; the *Ascending Heaven* and *Concealment* talismans are written in yellow on green silk. Some masters say: before declaring merit, perform these rites to completion, then lead the disciple to face north and bow four times to the Jade Throne of the Supreme Lord. Next, face east and bow twice to the Great Emperor Lord. Then, face south and bow twice to the Most High Perfected. Afterward, face west and bow twice to Master Zhang, the Heavenly Master. On the third day, the disciple declares merit, holds a fast to give thanks, and the rites are recorded in a separate scroll.

Next, the disciple performs the *Lance-Tablet Casting* rite in the direction of their life’s origin at the altar. Facing east, they knock their teeth together three times, offer incense, and pray:
"Most High Three Heavens, Primordial Three Qi, Supreme Lord Lao: summon forth the Three and Five Merit Officers within my body, the Left and Right Attendant Officers, the Left and Right Incense-Bearing Dragon Couriers, the Jade Lads and Jade Maidens who attend the incense, the Five Thearchs’ Direct Talismans, and the Daily Incense Officers—thirty-six of each—to emerge. I now burn incense and invoke the local earth deities and the true officials of the four directions. May the Supreme Lord’s ten-directional true qi enter my body, that my supplications ascend directly to the throne of the Most High, Perfect, and Great Sage, the Celestial Worthy and Jade Emperor."

Upon finishing, they turn to face the king and knock their teeth together twelve times. After reading the tablet, they pray:
"Heaven unfolds, earth extends,
The Nine Qi divide their numinous power.
The Three Origins share a single talisman,
The ten directions are mystically pure.
The Five Elder Thearchs,
Open the true and guide the living.
Cinnabar script and vermilion texts,
Primordial essence of the Highest Origin—
Universally proclaimed to the supreme,
The august spirits of the Nine Lands.
Today is most auspicious,
All immortals confirm life.
I vow for my immortal self,
To cast my jade name.
The Earth Mansion’s Great August One,
Erase my sinful form.
Submit the tablet to the Upper Palace,
Inscribe it in the Azure Register.
Swiftly attain flight and ascension,
Heaven and earth share their numinous power.
Nine generations of kin,
Rotten bones renewed in glory.
Souls ascend to the Southern Palace,
Transformed in the immortal courts.
Today I declare my mandate—
May all spirits heed!
With golden clasps I affirm
My utmost sincerity.
As I have petitioned, so let it be—
By golden dragon courier."

Upon completion, they offer incense and return to the incense burner, following the above method.

The *Highest Origin Numinous Treasure* addresses the Nine Earths’ Earth August Ones, the *Extinguishing Sins and Inscribing Names to Seek Immortality* method:
The *Numinous Treasure* and *Vermilion Thearch* female Daoist adept, So-and-so, aged such-and-such, born in such-and-such month, life registered under the Southern Dipper of the Nine Heavens.
Explanation: This text refers to the Vermilion Thearch as one whose life origin is in the *bing-wu* (fire-horse) year, and whose life is registered under the Nine Heavens if born in the first or second month. The Southern Dipper governs the direction of one’s life origin; the rest follows this pattern.
Vowing to become a spirit, vowing to become an immortal,
To attain long life and transcend the world,
To soar to the Upper Clarity,
The Central August of the Nine Lands.
The Yellow Spirits of *wu-ji*,
The Five Thearchs of the Earth Mansion—
I beseech you to erase my sin records,
Inscribe them in the Great Mystery.
Petition the Central Palace,
Cast the tablet to record my name.
Golden clasps affirm my faith,
Golden dragons courier the transmission.
In the year of such-and-such, such-and-such month, such-and-such day, at such-and-such prefecture, commandery, county, village, and hamlet, the petition is declared.

The right side is inscribed on a silver tablet in vermilion, wrapped in blue paper, bound with nine blue silk clasps, and sealed with one golden dragon. It is buried at the central palace of one’s residence. Next, present the spirit tablet, inscribe the tablet, and bury it in the corresponding direction of the altar. Alternatively, it may be cast into mountain ravines, deep springs, or abysses—let no one retrieve it.

Each tablet is one foot and two inches long, two inches and four fen wide, and three fen thick.

The *Altar Ascent Offerings* are as follows:
Twenty-four thousand gold coins (copper coins or treasures of equivalent value may be substituted).
Nine taels of gold.
One bolt each of five-colored silk.

Five large mats.
Five *he* boxes of blended incense, each holding two *dou* and five *sheng*.
Five incense burners.
One seven-star table.
One crimson-patterned cloth.
One five-*chi* double-layered turquoise-patterned cloth.
One five-*chi* double-layered cloth with five-colored scattered floral patterns, one *dou* in quantity.
Birth-year silk, its length measured by the year of one’s age.

For those born in the first or second month: their register belongs to the Azure Heaven, and their *qi* is linked to the Nine-*Qi* Heavenly Lords.
For those born in the fourth or fifth month: their register belongs to the Vermilion Heaven, and their *qi* is linked to the Three-*Qi* Lords.
For those born in the seventh or eighth month: their register belongs to the White Heaven, and their *qi* is linked to the Seven-*Qi* Heavenly Lords.
For those born in the tenth or eleventh month: their register belongs to the Mysterious Heaven, and their *qi* is linked to the Five-*Qi* Heavenly Lords.
For those born in the third, sixth, ninth, or twelfth month: their register belongs to the Yellow Heaven, and their *qi* is linked to the One-*Qi* Heavenly Lord.

According to the month of the ordination rite:
In the first or second month, state: “Now in the Three-*Qi* Heaven.”
In the fourth or fifth month, state: “Now in the Three-*Qi* Heaven.”
In the seventh or eighth month, state: “Now in the Seven-*Qi*.”
In the tenth or eleventh month, state: “Now in the Five-*Qi* Heaven.”
In the third, sixth, ninth, or twelfth month, state: “Now in the One-*Qi* Heaven.”

The *Highest Dongxuan Lingbao Ordination Rites* are here concluded.
